text: There is nothing i liked about this place at all, I came here because it was close by and had good reviews, however I am not sure why it does. I shared  four sushi rolls with my sister and only sort of liked one of them. One had so much mayo on it I felt like I was just putting a spoonful of mayo in my mouth (I think it was called the super spicy roll.) It is also a very tiny place. Tables are so close together it makes it uncomfortable to talk to the person you are dining with... also it took a very long time to get our food soooo yeah I would not go back!
Nothing to go nuts about. Sushi was average. Environment is subpar. Service was uncomfortable. They speak quietly and don't greet you at the door.

Outstanding sushi and exemplary customer service!  I only wish I lived closer!  
I was visiting from out of town and was searching for sushi on my way to the airport.  I looked at the Yelp reviews and knew I had to make NZ Cafe a stop on my itinerary.  The sushi was amazing! The Wasabi Salmon Roll was one of the best I have ever had.  But the customer service really impressed me.  I lost my receipt and a week later called to get a copy.  The person who answered the phone took the time to search through their records to find it for me.  She was going to fax it to me, but their fax could not dial a long distance number, so the owner faxed it to me from her home fax at 1:30 AM that night when she got home.  I don't know many restaurants who would put that kind of effort into helping a one-time customer.  However, if I ever am back in Charlotte, I will be going back!

Love love love this place. We come here when we want good sushi. My favorite will forever be spicy salmon but they have several great rolls. 

The place is small and can get super crowded but it's worth it. The staff is really nice as well.

Been coming here for years. Great hole in the wall restaurant for sushi or any other Asian fusion dish. Best sushi in town and also best value, very afordable. Get there early as it has a small dining room and there are always lines out the door. Staff and owners are also great people and very friendly.

I finally made my first trip to New Zealand Cafe to find out what all the fuss is about and dang if you kids weren't lying.

We made it there just in time on a Sunday evening so that we didn't have to wait for a table and started things off with some edamame and a couple sushi rolls.  The edamame was extra salty (just how I like it) and the sushi was delish!

I ordered the Trio Special as an entree (I think that was the name).  It consisted of chicken, beef and shrimp in a spicy brown sauce along with your choice of brown rice or garlic noodles.  It is served with a small salad, with what seem to be a watered down shrimp sauce as the dressing, two crab ragoons, and two small chicken skewers.  All for $6.95, are you kidding me?

The service was excellent I considered deducting a star because the place is so small, but hey, I like it like that.  I had a to go box that did not survive very long and as others have mentioned the leftovers were awesome!  I definately recommend you check this place out and you can get out real cheap if you skip the apps/sushi/alcohol.

I'd just like to say as a born and bred New Zealander the only thing NZ about the place is the sign and some wine. I'd understand if this was listed under pacific fusion but after looking at the menu the name makes little sense apart from perhaps capitalizing off our image...

If you are tired of trying to find the best Sushi in town, this is it. If your friends or family say different just stick to your guns on this wonderful jewel of a place. The best Sushi I've ever had, bar none!!! If you're not sure of what you'd like ask for Kathy and describe what texture and taste, she or her husband will nail it!!!
Everything is wonderful, been going here for over 10 years, nothing compares.
I hate to tell you about it because it's already busy without you!!!

This is a difficult review. 4 star sushi & prices...ZERO for customer service & wait time..not our 1st time here..and every time is at least a 1 hour (don't take reservations) wait (if you're lucky)...tonite tipped the scale to never coming back..EVER!! Front of house was so far out in the weeds! After 40 minute wait time,  was told at least 30-40 min longer still wait time..Great spot that needs a much larger space for eat-in customers..judging by wait time for eat-in & volume of take out, they could easily support a larger place..sorry New Zealand, we are done with you

Great sushi! I had an issue with an entr√©e I ordered but management took care of the issue and removed the order from my bill. 

Giving 4-stars only because my waitress was very nonchalant and had an issue with MY dissatisfaction with my meal. I only wanted what I ordered. 

Just hope her day got better. Will more than likely come back if I'm on this side of town but won't make an effort to travel across town again.
Love this place. awesome sushi for great prices. I've been ordering from here for years and it's still one of my favorite place to go out to
Always friendly service and very good food. Good size portions and great quality!  Try the bento box...you won't leave hungry.  Great sushi and intimate atmosphere.   A must dine at in Charlotte.

Oh.my.God.

I've had this place bookmarked for almost a year, and when visiting family wanted sushi last weekend, I thought it would be a good time to try it out.  When we pulled up we were all very skeptical - it is not much to look at from the outside.  

Well, it was incredible.  Best sushi in Charlotte, no argument.  The two rolls I ordered -- the Big Boss (I think) and the Shrimp and Crab (I think - I can't remember) were perfection.  It is 100% worth the trek out there if you do not live nearby. Service was great even though they were slammed.  It didn't bother me too much, but you should know that many of the printed menus contain different items - so take a look at the 100 menus they give you.

I cannot WAIT to go back and I'm hoping it becomes a weekly tradition (or hopefully more often!)

We have been visiting New Zealand Cafe since it opened.  Sad that I am so late reviewing it.  What can I say about this place?  It is one of the top sushi restaurants in Charlotte.  It looks so unassuming from the outside in a strip-mall but boy does this place deliver!  It is small so if you get there right in the lunch or dinner crush, be prepared to wait...awhile.  We have waited for up to 1.5hrs and it was totally worth it.  We try to get there early.  The food quality is superb and the menu is extensive.  Plenty of options for the sushi fanatic.  Our kids started on Kani years ago and have graduated to more exotic and spicier rolls.  Of course they still love Kani lol.  Very high quality for reasonable prices.  Chef and his wife are super people too.
I love this place. The BEST SUSHI IN MATTHEWS! They are very far price for their food and they have a really friendly staff . I would eat here everyday if I could.
Awesome food. Very good value for the money. Sushi as fresh as can be and the meal trays can't be beat.

My wife and I love coming here for dinner. We moved to a new house nearby and learned about New Zealand Cafe from the previous owner. The sushi rolls have always been terrific and the service is friendly. Don't be put off by the low key setting, you won't be disappointed. Though I've never had to wait when I've come here, I suppose it can get pretty crowded at peak times.

Hands down the best sushi place in town! And you wouldn't even believe that when you see the place, but its super yummy. 

I love all their sushi rolls! The prices are well price, quality is good, sushi is good and you will not leave being disappointed if you are a sushi lover!

The only downfall is that this place is so tiny, it only holds about 40 people. So if you go during dinner time there is usually a 20-60 minute wait. I like to go during lunch hour or before the dinner rush. But there has been time where I've waited for over an hour to get a seat. 

Recommended Sushi Rolls: 

Sweet Dragon Roll
Crunch Max Roll
Caterpillar Roll 
Spider Roll
Dragon Roll

LOVE THE SUSHI...its always fresh and delicious....the only thing i hate its how small and over crowded always busy it is....if ur Starving...DO NOT go eat here.... bc u will most likely have to wait...other than that....its great!!!
Great sushi at a fair price. Every pay day i drop in here for a delicious meal.

These people are very friendly and accommodating. The sushi is amazing. We get a lot of to go orders for a large group and they are always helpful and accurate on all our orders. This is definitely one of my favorite spots.

I came here with my wife and kids.  Upon arriving around 7:30 noticed there were a lot of people outside.  The wait was about 40 minutes and for a Friday night not bad.  With that said this place is worth the wait.  Service was excellent and the food was great.  I even got sushi to go.  My kids 4, 11, and 13 loved it.  The price is also a plus.  I would definitely recommend this place.  We will definitely be back to try some mire great sushi!!

Sushis ok our server was really nice but we didn't like the caterpillar roll and we told her we felt really bad but we just didn't like it and we wanted to order something else our server was super nice about it and said she was just gonna let the manager know when the manager came up to she asked what was wrong and we told her that we just didn't like it and it wasn't what we were expecting and that we were sorry and she told us very Rudely that next time we should just get a piece  to try and not do that again and she was very angry and rude and when  we told her we would like to see the menu to get other stuff she rolled her eyes at us and angrily walked away and told our server to get us menus, after being treated like that from her I just wanted to leave don't think I'll be coming back and I hope she fixes her attitude !

One of the best kept secrets in the Charlotte area for sushi! My favorite roll is the crunchy spicy tuna roll, but everything I've tried has been good. The restaurant is a little small, so get there early to avoid a wait. Amazing sushi for the price.

Great place with great service and sushi! Everything was very fresh and for very reasonable prices. I spent $56 on tons of food for 2 people that I would have spent double in most sushi restaurants. The place must have a lot of return customers bc the owners and staff greet many by their first name. I highly recommend this place and when I visit SC again, I will definitely make another stop here!

Overall the place is fairly good.
The prices are reasonable (probably due to cheap rent) and the portions decent.

BUT, 4 stars is generous considering it was pretty dirty... the bathrooms, the sushi station, uniforms, procedures, etc.  And that's a big dinning turn-off, especially for sushi.  Also, maybe it was just the setting, but the fish tasted like a lower grade than other places I like around town.
its been all said already ,what are yo u waiting for, you want some good sushi or not. took one star off for the small seating area, foods is great tho, go go go

This place is horrible. Horrible food. Horrible service. I have come here twice because this place has such great reviews and both times have walked away confused because I have no clue what people like about this place. I guess see for yourself. I mean, after all some people love olive garden and that lobster place. This seems like the sushi equivalent.

Another one of my favorite places to dine. Everything is delicious, from the Kami Nigiri to the Teriyaki Chicken Bento Box. I highly recommend eating here. Even when it's busy, service is still satisfactory.

Why am I just now finding this place?  We arrived early on a Saturday night thinking we'd for sure beat any crowd if a crowd was going to exist in the first place.  The only seats available were at the sushi bar - this little place was packed!  I later decided this was the best possible seat in the house because you get to see everything Jackie and his buddies are slicing up and ask all sorts of questions.

A ton of food.  High quality sushi.  Great service.  Cheap - Really cheap. We had a squid salad, 2 specialty rolls, a chicken and shrimp hibachi platter, and adult beverages....total charge was in the low $30s.

Can't wait to go back.  Even if it's for carry-out.  Diamond in the rough.

New Zealand offers the absolute best sushi in Charlotte hands down! There's not a lot of seating so expect a LONG wait if you want to dine in. They don't take reservations and that hasn't hurt them.  New Zealand is definitely one of Charlotte's hidden treasures.  Plus...show them your driver's license on your birthday and your meal us on the house!!

First time dining here. My wife and I were both impressed with the freshness of everything we ordered. Quick and polite service. They sure keep this small place packed. I was also impressed that there was a continuous flow of people picking up takeout. We will definitely dine here again. oh!  I almost forgot; the prices are very reasonable!  Sushi dinner for two with soup and salad for under $50!

This is the best sushi place in Charlotte. Man! It is a bit expensive but it it totally worth it. Close your eyes and randomly pick an item, you cannot go wrong.

Service was great. You feel like family when you come in. You can tell they truly appreciate your business.

It's only flaw, it's located in a strip mall and is very small. Seating is limited and the wait can be long depending on when get there. 

You can never go wrong with takeout.

The sushi here. Omg. Me and my hubby made our first trip here around 8pm they were super packed... We waited outside for about 20 minutes. Once seated we were immediately handed our menus and took our order fairly quickly. The inside is small and cramped and loud... That being said the food was AMAZING!!!! My boyfriend, and avid sushi lover said they had the best sushi he has had in Charlotte. I enjoyed their lobster roll, the ingredients were fresh, the food well made and presented beautifully. Not a great place if your in a hurry or dislike crowds, but for good food at good prices, it can't be beat.

The name, New Zealand Cafe, is quite misleading. We've never been to New Zealand (the country), and are not at all familiar with its cuisine. We also would not consider it a "cafe" per se. Overlook the name and get yourself to New Zealand Cafe at your very first opportunity. A very pleasant surprise awaits you. This is a real deal Japanese establishment. The centerpiece, at least for us, is the sushi bar although table seating is available along with an array of traditional non-sushi menu offerings. We go there for sushi alone, at the sushi bar, and have yet to take a table. I must mention that the sushi bar only seats 5, so you may have to wait during peak periods. Believe me, the wait will be totally worth it. If you are rushed or impatient, fret not, all sushi bar offerings are also served table-side.

Jackie, the owner and Chief Itamae, is an incredibly warm and engaging person. He's also very focused and most passionate about his establishment and delivers outstanding sushi, from his hands to your palate. His assistants are trained by him and he keeps a gentle watch over them, ensuring that we, his patrons, receive top quality at all times. We've been there in his absence, and the quality doesn't falter. His persona, however, is missed on those rare occasions.

We typically order a diverse variety of sushi and sashimi, so much so that it's served to us in a large wooden "boat" - an artfully tasteful and traditional Japanese presentation that never fails to garner the awe of fellow patrons. Our favorites include: Toro, Mackerel, Yellowtail, Albacore, Scallops (both regular and spicy), Uni with optional Quail Egg, Flying Fish Row with optional Quail Egg, Eel, and Baby Octopus. As starters for us, the Calamari Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll, Crab and Shrimp Roll, Salmon Skin Roll and Tuna Tartare are all excellent.

I've eaten sushi around the globe regularly for 40 years, know it well, and can attest without reservation that New Zealand Cafe offers the very best sushi in Charlotte, NC. Just take a look at the numerous awards and proclamations proudly displayed on the wall behind the sushi bar.

What are you waiting for??? Go there, NOW!!!
This place was okay. Sushi was basic - not bad but not the greatest. Service wasn't so great. The waitress was rude. We waited a while for the food. Wouldn't recommend.

4 specialty rolls and 2 nigiri. $40 well spent. Don't be worried that their online menu only has like 15 rolls on it. Inside you are given 3 different sushi menus, all with tons of options. Favorites were the Volcano and Wasabi Tuna. Cheap, quality sushi!

This is probably some of the best sushi I have ever had. Fresh, incredibly flavorful.  There is usually a wait, but as soon as you get the food, it makes up for it. If you are looking for authentic Japanese food, you NEED to come here!!
Hands down one of the best sushi places in the area!! This place is hidden in the south east part of Charlotte and very underestimated. Fresh, quick and cheap.

I took a chance trying this place but I heard some people say that's the only place they'll eat sushi.  I had 2 pieces of sushi and they were very fresh but I was saving room for an entree.  They have a great selection of food and I was very impressed at the taste, presentation and quantity of food.  I'll definitely be back!

This was a little bit out of the way for me, but it was worth the drive. It's a cute little place, and I mean little--it probably seats 40 if all the tables are full. If there is a wait you have to stand outside, which is not so great on a chilly night. Despite the small size and large number of people waiting for tables, it only took about 10 minutes for us to get a table. This might have been because we were just 2, but they do seem to turn over tables efficiently.

In terms of food, the sushi was fantastic and reasonably priced. They have a tempura vegetable roll, which is a welcome change to the "typical" veggie sushi rolls that involve some combination of avocado, cucumber, asparagus, and carrots. They also have fried tofu nigiri, which is one of my favorites. The rest of the menu isn't super vegetarian-friendly, but there are a couple of options.

I will definitely be visiting again!
Undoubtedly the best sushi around at an incredible price.  Best service in town . Small place & excellent food means they are busy.   Always a wait between 6:49 and 8:30...but well worth it.

Love love love love NZ Cafe. The best sushi I have had anywhere in Charlotte. I agree with those who say it towers above the rest. I've never had an experience where I felt any of my raw fish was less than perfectly fresh---- even on a Sunday, where the fish couldn't have been delivered that same day. My husband is a chef so we never get to go out Fri or Sat and I've learned that going out on a Sunday or a Monday is the true test of the quality of a restaurant. 

As for the "complaints" on the wait times and size of the restaurant I have seen on here-- that's part of the deal when you go out to eat! When something is good people take notice and sometimes, yes you have to wait for a table! 

I can't believe anyone reviewing NZ would write anything bad about the staff, as I have always felt them to be extremely friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, and generally a well-oiled team. People who do not work in the food service industry conveniently are unaware of the fact that restaurant staff usually have many things on their mental to-do list at one time and many hungry people to make happy and run around trying to remember everything and keep their heads above water when they are
 busy. That may have been a run on sentence but I wanted to make my point.

As for what I order our guilty pleasure is the Favorite Roll. Totally gringo but I don't care it's that delicious. Could go on and on about all the great rolls we've had there, as well as nigiri, and their cooked entrees as well. Looking forward to going back tonight.
Have brought friends and family here and they all agree that New Zealand is the best in Charlotte!
Everything is good. There is plenty on the menu for someone that doesn't like sushi. The sushi is the best I've had in Charlotte though. Always fresh and delicious!

AMAZING SUSHI!!!! Wonderful service! Only issue is, don't come super hungry because you will have to wait on a weekend as it is VERY busy. But it's only that busy because the sushi is so wonderful and so cheap!

What a find this place is! Very good-toexcellent quality sushi. The Chinese/Asian dishes are very good quality, tasty and cheap! Most of their dinner entrees are under $10. Seriously, this place is wonderful, I highly recommend trying it out.

P.S. Place is small so you may wait, but it's worth it!

Best sushi in town. Hands down. Just saying. =)

But no, seriously, for the price, you couldn't do better! People go for atmosphere these days rather than the quality of food and getting your money's worth. This is the place to be if you actually want good sushi!
I love you, New Zealand Cafe. Wanna make a sushi baby with you. Don't go anywhere else in/around Matthews for sushi. Or else...

Nothing to see here!  Move along, move along!!

(to my chagrin, this is a well-kept secret no longer....)


Very fresh, affordable sushi.  Tiny location in a strip mall, seating is very limited.  Best sushi option in the Matthews/SE CLT area, by far.

If you are doing take out, give yourself plenty of time -- they can get backed up, especially on the weekends.
I stopped by this place with my daughter and this roll was amazing!!!even though the line was very long it was worth it!!! Highly recommend !!!
New Zealand Cafe is a neighborhood favorite. Menu is large and varied. Dishes are beautifully prepared.  Get there early as there is usually a line
Awesome sushi great service   Never disappointed when I eat at New Zealand Cafe!!  Hidden amongst the Chain restaurants that litter the Charlotte landscape.

Food was just okay. Service was horrendous!  Waitress seemed to be hiding in the back.  We got there at 1pm on a weekday and didn't get out until 3pm. And the place wasn't that crowded. After waiting an hour, they got my order wrong.

Best sushi place in the Charlotte area! Only issue I have is the environment. Cheesy string lights, fake dusty plants and a cramped area make it less appealing. But, the sushi is soooo good. Crispy Eel roll is the BEST!

When we arrived to the location, he said, OH OH, this is not going to be good, the outside look does not invite you to go inside, but this place was highly recomend for a friend, that we said, well let's try... Inside it looks much better...

The attention was really good, the ladies were really nice and check on us all the time.

The food, well, GREAT  food!! Fresh and tasty!!!! I highly recomend this place for a great sushi experience. I did not give 5 star because it took a while for them to bring our food.

I have been dining there for many years and even if I go 6 months between visits, they still remember my first name. I LOVE their sushi! It might be a small restaurant but it's got a big heart. Great food and service.
No doubt best sushi in town..Jackie rocks.

Worst sashimi I've had in Charlotte.  

I imagine this place has such high reviews because people get rolls with fried shit and spicy mayo all over it... so, of course it tastes good and masks not-fresh fish.

I had a sashimi platter and a bunch of nigiri a la carte.  It was all bad.  Some of the fish tasted frozen/half-thawed out, some of it tasted like it was soaking in water... watery sashimi? I don't know, that was a first for me, too.

My friend loved his salmon skin hand rolls, but I declined to try some because I was so over it.
I was one of those "I hate sushi people.  Until I was forced to eat at new Zealand.  Delicious. I recommend take out because the restaurant is always packed

I was very surprised by this place. It had a great selection of food and it was delicious. I will definitely be going back. Also, try the fried banana. I'm not usually a fan of fried bananas but my girlfriend made me get it and I'm glad I did.

Our favorite sushi place, despite the long commute (30+min on 485). Great variety of rolls and nigiri/sashimi. They have delicious uni which is a huge plus for us. We like the casual environment this place offers.

One of the waitresses knows us so well, the first thing she will ask us is if we'd like to put in our order for the Fantasy Shrimp bento and to give us a pen knowing we always order about 20 pieces of random fresh nigiris and sashimis. They take care of you here, if you give them a chance.

Our only complaint is that the place is tiny which means there can be a bit of a wait for seating and your food, but it hasn't stopped us from coming back. This place isn't for everyone, and we are OK with that. :)

with all of the great reviews, I was hoping for so much more.  
There are better places near uptown Charlotte and surrounding neighborhoods. I found the sushi average at best.

I love this place. I feel that if they expanded, it just wouldnt be the same, I think the atmosphere is conducive to its size, and having a small wait at the door is perfect for this small little joint.
The sushi i ordered, Spicy Tuna Maki, Eel Dragon, Fire Cracker Roll and Shrimp Tempura roll, 4 orders total, came out on a giant boat, which made me feel like a pig, but after the first bites of each roll, I wasnt caring what anyone else was thinking. Service was friendly and attentive, and we got everything we ordered, and fast. This is s great spot. I look forward to doing it again soon!

The service has gone down hill tremendously. We waited an hour for our food while everyone around us got their food. We were offered no apology at all and were never told that we would be waiting for a long period of time. Also, I am vegan and ordered vegetable sushi and it came with smelt Roe all over the rice due to lack of care. They brought out a replacement, but between that and the wait I was not pleased. The last four times I've been there my experiences have been similar and poor. It is sad because this used to be my favorite restaurant.

NZ Cafe is easily my favorite sushi spot in the area. I can't believe I haven't reviewed it before. Today's selection was a Rainbow Roll & saba. My daughter had the Queenstown Chicken with garlic noodles. We both ate every bite. NZ Cafe is consistently delicious & affordable. The service is always top notch.

I am very conservative on accolades on yelp.  Charlotte is devoid of a selection and variety of restaurants but this place is an absolute gem.  We drive 45 minutes across town to eat here.  Prices are fair, service is good, the sushi is excellent.  Presentation is great, the rice is perfect, and the portions are abot 20-30% more than anywhere in town.  Try the Ichiban roll!  Went on monday night at 7:00 and place was full, but only waited 5 minutes for table.  The dining room is small and a bit tight, but the food makes up for lack of elbow room.

The sushi here is absolutely delicious.  Never have I craved sushi until I ate here.  The service is slow compared to other restaurants but I suspect that is because of the quality of food you are receiving.  The Firecracker Roll is BY FAR one of the best things I have ever eaten.  The Dynamite Roll is very good.  The Hamachi Nigiri (farmed yellowtail) was delicate and delicious.  Their Unagi Nigiri is amazing.  Enjoy!

The best value for sushi in CLT. Hesitant to write this review as if word spreads about this place, will never be able to get a table.  It is very small and just a shade above "hole in the wall" category.

The only place that rivals this is Enso, but prices there are 2-3x higher.
If you're reading this, stop it and just don't hesitate any longer to come to this place... what a deliocious sushi, it was worth the wait no kidding.

The best sushi in Charlotte, the best I have ever had, and it is not close.

I have been going to NZ Cafe for 5 years or more and it is great every ... single ...time.  I have tried many of the rools, but live the tuna avocado and spicy tuna rolls.  I go with soy paper over seaweed and that's easily done here.  Service is great and prices are CHEAP!  

I was a giant fan of Ru San in Dilworth for years.  Then Ru San picked up a poor score on the sanitary scale and that was the end of it for me.  NZ is always at "A", kinda critical for a sushi place (with a C, sushi becomes bait).

My wife and I love this place. This is our go to sushi place in Charlotte. The wait is always long but it is well worth it. I keep telling everyone I k ow about New Zealand and how amazing the sushi Rolls are. If you want great sushi come here. Best place in Charlotte in my opinion.

I just moved to the area and really, really, really wanted to like NZ Cafe. Based on the Yelp reviews, the typical lines and the fact I really wanted a good sushi place within a mile from where I live. So much so that I even went twice.

I should note I have only had the sushi, and I try to stick with sashimi and rolls without fried anything and I stay away from the entire fried rolls. Maybe their other stuff is better. I did like their bamboo roll, which is basically just fish wrapped in cucumber in a little ponzu sauce. Their eel isn't bad.

Everything else? Completely average at best. The rolls are way too large and have way too much rice. I popped the avocado off of a roll only to see a pencil-sized bit of filling in the middle of a giant wad of rice.

The fish seemed to be a bit fresher than average but I struggled to eat it or taste it around way too much rice. Some of the rolls are just bad. I couldn't manage to eat a grilled tuna roll.

I'd give the food about three stars (average), but the super-cramped space and the lines (why are there lines?) drop it down to about two stars. I'm regrettably driving farther for sushi now.

GO THERE! is all I can say! The food is delicious! I had it on Tuesday night and I am going back tonight to have this yummy yummy yummy food. I even had leftovers from Tuesday night and ate it as breakfast the next morning. I swear it tasted better, lol. Customer service is wonderful, although the place is a bit cramped... you can tell its becoming popular. I wont be surprised if they need a new location. I am so happy to have found a new place to eat out at, and close to home!!
Long wait, but the fried oyster roll is so worth it!!!!!! The best sushi in Charlotte!

Still our favorite Sushi in town, have not been here for months just revisted twice in last month. Treated a friend from Raleigh this last visit. They were very impressed. We did have a wait, arrived during the busiest part of evening but well worth it.

Really great place. It's small so you'll probably have to wait to get a table during busy times, but that's really the only negative. The food is terrific, especially for the price. And this is the restaurant that convinced me that I like sushi. I've had sushi at several other places since but none of it is quite as good as what you'll get here. Recommend all the way.

My husband and I came here last night with another couple....this might now be my favorite sushi in Charlotte!! It's a hole in the wall sushi place within a strip mall. 

We split 7 rolls between the 4 of us and it was a TON of food. They even brought it out in a boat (ok, ok, we requested the boat because eating a ton of sushi out of a boat is just so much cooler than on a plate!!). We ordered the cilantro roll, valentine roll, dynamite roll, sweet dragon roll, wasabi roll, christmas roll, and volcano roll. All were absolutely delish! My favorites were the cilantro roll (just super refreshing and light....loved the lemon on top) and the valentine roll (soy paper and shaped like a heart!) No man was left behind on our boat!

Prices were very good. I think the final bill was a little under $40 a couple for all those rolls.

Just a note, this place is very very small. So, I would come early or later to avoid waiting for a table. We live in Uptown, so it is a hike to get to New Zealand. However, I think it'll be worth the drive when my next sushi craving comes around!
Great food, friendly staff. There is limited seating (I sat directly next to where customers paid - they would sometimes lean next to my plate), thus the 4 stars. The food was worth it, though!

Dont let the Dumb name fool you, this is a good sushi place with no "New Zealand" food or flair. It is a small little place with some good fresh sushi! This is the first place in Charlotte that I have actually really liked their food, as far as sushi goes that is. When you do go there, know that you will be sitting very close to other patrons and will be able to hear what everyone is talking about in the restaurant. The staff is very friendly and accommodating towards odd orders which is nice. The Spicy Mayo is very Mayoie or however you spell that word. Go there on your Birthday and you will get a free meal, 21 and over and make sure you bring your ID. I recommend this place as long as your in the area. I will be going back!

Excellent choice for amazing sushi, excellent prices.
Went in Tuesday night and the place was packed.
Great prices.

New Zealand cafe is delicious, but Geez... it's time to expand your restaurant... it's SOO cramped in there. Just waiting for a to go order, they send you to the hallway to sit in a chair so you're out of the way of the servers... but then you end up awkwardly being squeezed past by patrons trying to use the restroom at the other end of the hall
I've tried almost any and every place in charlotte that sells sushi and New Zealand has everyone of them beat!!! I've been going here for 10+ years now and have never had a bad experience.

Food was AWESOME and cheaper than I would've believed, with no sacrifice of quality.  I got a salad, an 8 pc roll and a piece of nigiri for just over $8.  The service was... polite and prompt, but rather less pleasant than I usually expect.  That being said, I'll happily overlook the somewhat mechanical service and come back for the food on a regular basis!

I've only been here twice, but I AM IN LOVE with New Zealand Cafe. This place is tucked away in an nondescript strip mall and I'd say it's a hidden gem for sushi! 

The both times I've been here, we had to wait to be seated because it was busy and it stays busy (rightfully so because the food is so gooood). The restaurant is pretty small, cozy, and always packed with patrons so it takes the sushi chefs some time to get the sushi out. I can't complain though, their sushi is absolutely worth the wait!

I came with a party of 8-10 each time, and everyone just picked an order of sushi of their choice and then we all just dug in and shared. I've probably had 15+ different orders of their sushi and I can't complain about a single one! Their sushi ingredients are fresh and their rice is done right. Not only is their sushi DELISH, it's completely affordable and they're actually a pretty big size. The service has always been wonderful as well, the staff is so friendly and attentive. 

In summary, New Zealand Cafe is hands down one of my favorite sushi joints in Charlotte. I don't want to go anywhere else for sushi! Love this place! I'd eat here every day if I could but I'd rather not see a huge spike of mercury levels in my body.

The food and service used to be good here but now is horrible. I called in an order and was told 40 min and an hour and a half later my food was still not ready. They gave us food that was not ours and then realized they hadn't made our food. Was told we would be given a refund but then only received a refund for one item which was the cheapest. You also have to continuously get bumped into while waiting because there is no room. Until they make changes I will not be back.

This is my favorite sushi place in Charlotte! Words can't describe how happy I am that I have discovered this gem of a place. I wish the absolute best for the owners but sometimes, for my own selfish reasons, I hope they don't expand because most restaurants that expand, often don't do things the same. Such as, the chef's are different and the prices increase because of whatever reason... It's just.. This place is perfect and I don't want anything to change. And plus, I don't want any more people to know about this place because this place can get packed real quick. I'm just joking... Sorta.

The sushi here is spectacular and at a reasonable price too. The quality of the sashimi is just incredible and especially for the price. It's a bang for your buck!! And for my non sushi lovers out there, the bento box is great also, really good portions. 

Favorite dishes:
Big Boss Roll
Lobster King Roll
Century Roll
Sake Nigiri
Tuna Tataki 
Poke
Squid Salad
Fried Ice Cream

I've been here many times and the food is always good. It may be too "Americanized" for sushi  aficionados and the decor inside is strange for a Japanese restaurant, but everything I've ever had here has been delicious! It gets very crowded on the weekends so, get there early. I don't see how anyone could give this place less than four stars. Definitely recommend!

Wow. Delicious! Stopped by randomly and the place was packed on a Sat at 12pm, so you know it has to be good. The wait was long due to it, but expected and well worth it. All sushi rolls were great, soup and lomein were great and they even have a kids menu. Def coming back!

Average sushi, some creative rolls you won't see anywhere else. But it's SO crowded, we never go during prime dinner hours. And the strangest thing is there always seems to be at least six waiters, but service is always slow. Drink your drinks slowly, and ask for any extras all at the same time.

Maybe the best sushi I've ever had. Rolls & bento boxes were all so good, you really can't go wrong. Not only is the food itself SO GOOD, the price makes it 10x better. My family and I got 4 rolls (2 were the most expensive on the menu), 2 bento boxes, 5 nigiri pieces, & miso soup for $63. We're on vacation for a week and will no doubt be back before we leave. 

If you're looking for sushi, absolutely go here. It's a small place but it is absolutely worth the short wait to get in.
Great choices and reasonably priced- What more can I ask for! I will keep going back for my sushi 'fix'! Loved their salmon skin roll. Unagi!

I have been on the hunt for good sushi places since I moved to Charlotte from AZ / SoCal. This is my all time favorite place. As close to west coast sushi as you can get and some of the rolls are better then what I get in San Diego. The servers are always nice and I sit at the sushi bar to bs with the sushi chefs. If I could give them more stars I would.

*Ding, Ding, Ding, Ding* I've found a winner! 

Ok, so for the past two days (June 7th & 8th), the hubs and I have been celebrating and partying like we were back in College. It was our 3rd Anniversay and my 27th birthday so we hit up a few places in Charlotte and we were not disappointed. After we checked out of the Sierra Hotel (which I will be reviewing in a lil' bit) the hubs took me to New Zealand Cafe for lunch. It's off North Sardis road in a strip mall type setting.

I was really excited to be having lunch here b/c all the sushi buffs I know have been saying this is the best sushi in Charlotte. AND THEY WEREN'T LIEING! At first glance I didn't know what to make of the decor, it's a hodge-podge of japanese design/nautical elements/viking-esque wall art. But I wasn't here for the decor, I wanted to inhale some SUSHI! We were greeted instantly and told to grab a seat, so we sat near the door as everywhere else was taken. I can't remember the name of our server, but she was very petite and wore a big smile. She took our drink order and handed us three different menus. The hubs told her it was my birthday and with that she smiled and said, "Oooh you get a free meal today!" I was estatic, I showed her my DL and she pointed out what I could order for free. I chose the Hibachi Chicken and Shrimp platter, I also ordered a Sweet Dragon Roll and the hubs ordered a Rainbow Roll.

It took about 10 minutes and I was in Sushi heaven...the sweet dragon roll was perfect dipped in my concoction of soy sauce, wasabi and mayo dipping sauce. Now on to the Hibachi Chicken and Shrimp platter that came out in a cute little tray. It was an assortment of crab-n-creme cheese wontons, chicken on a stick, broccoli, onions. zuchini and of course shrimp and chicken. It was sooo good! The sushi was so fresh, you could tell they use the best ingredients. The portion was the perfect size although I could not finish the entire roll but the hubs was on hand to polish off what I couldn't.

All-in-all, New Zealand Cafe gets five stars for it's friendly servers, mom and pop feel and quality sushi! :-)
Great place and our kids loved it!  Excellent service. Worth the wait, because it is small and crowded.

Best sushi in Charlotte hands down. I've tried almost everywhere in charlotte, this is by far the best place. 
I've been coming here for years.

Best sushi in town for sure. Best I've had in U.S. Calamari to die for. Tuna Poki extra spicy.  Mot on menu but great. Cathy forgets nothing. Jackie is the best.  Eating here for 10 years. At least twice a month.

Love this restaurant. Small place and very popular so we traditionally won't go with a party over 4 people. Bento box is the way to go for me. It's very well balanced with your entree, salad, etc. Service is always on point at lunch to keep the tables turning but I've never felt rushed.
New Zealand Cafe is the best sushi place in Charlotte, hands down! Especially for the price. It may be small and not as trendy as Nikkos (which I love as well), but it constantly delivers!

Wonderful little sushi place...and I do mean little. I had the crab salad and the app with spring rolls, dumplings and shrimp...amazing! Found out my Sister & Bro in-law are regulars. Great food, nice staff...we will be back. I do wish they had a better variety of drinks though. Wine, beer & soft drinks only.

Sashimi Bento Box was good. It could be better but for the cheap price I paid it was worth it. Toro & Ikura nigiri were splendid! The food service was quick! The atmosphere here is great too... Very casual but good. I will definitely come back.
Only okay. Cheap sushi, garlic noodles were dry and tasted nothing like garlic. I wouldn't go back.

Awful. Both food and ambience.
After a 30 minute wait (that's OK for a good restaurant) we were seated at a small table wedged into a cost efficient row of similar two foot tables literally inches from other diners. No way to avoid their conversation, and that's not what their website photo shows. 
The food was badly timed with my meal, Mayalasia Buttered Shrimp,  coming before we had finished our appetizers. It was dry and unmemorable. My wife's main dish--a large rainbow roll, didn't even arrive until after she remided the waitress and then I had completed my meal and needed to look anywhere but to the side so as to not stare at elbow-buddy fellow diners as my wife completed her forgotten and then delayed dish.

There are many good reviews but unfortunately we found nothing memorable in any positive way.
Place is small but it is GOOD! My new favorite sushi spot!

Love this place!  Great sushi, great prices, only warning is you need to get there early as it is not a big space.  Place is always crowded though which should tell you something.  Best sushi I have had in Charlotte.

Our favorite sushi in charlotte! We always order take out because the restaurant is small. We love the crispy California rolls and vegetable tempura roll as well. Can't really go wrong with trying any of their rolls.

Yum! sushi is awesome. A lot of deep fried rolls, which I am not a huge fan of. But we ordered 4 rolls and they were all good. (I'm not sure if it was worth the 45 min wait for a table). They seem to have a quantity over quality mindset, when it comes to seating tables and doing to go orders. The restaurant is tiny though, so arrive early if you want want to go on a weekend.

The service is very slow do to having only one waiter wait on 6 or so tables. The sushi is very good tho so I guess it's worth the wait. We waited about an hour for a table and when we finally got a table we waited another 15 minutes just to order our drinks and food since we looked at the menu outside. Appetizers came around 25 minutes in and the sushi started coming around an hour later. In all the food was great we had grab ragoons and all sorts of sushi from the charlotte roll, philly roll, spicy salmon, wasabi roll and so on we also had the family chicken with veggies and brown rice which was the last thing served to us and 5 minutes later we got the check which was not very pleasing. They took a very long time getting our receipts back which was about 10 minutes. It was a good place for food but if you're in a hurry I don't recommend it.

Best sushi in Charlotte, hands down. The Valentine Roll is my absolute favorite and I order it every time. Even if I don't have time to stop and eat, I order it to go almost every time I'm in the area. They don't take reservations so if you're in a rush, make sure you're really early. The restaurant is TINY but the food is incredible. If you're looking for good sushi with knowledgeable staff that can make recommendations, this is your place!

Good sushi for good prices! I tried the Dancing eel
Roll & Charlotte roll on different trips here and had fresh flavors both times. I think there are fancier sushi restaurants in town but this place had good flavors & service!  It can get crowded at lunch time. It is in a shopping plaza so look for the sign near Harris Teeter.
This is a very intimate space, with tons of good choices and a great value!

Wow, just wow. For a hole in the wall restaurant in a strip mall who would've thought you could get this kind of quality sushi?? So the bad...the place is packed and you'll have to wait, once you get seated be prepared to wait some more. This place has a very high demand for take out, I'm assuming via phone orders...so even though they have a full staff making sushi non stop the wait for your food is going to be longer than what most people would be accustomed to. Now, why is this still 5 stars?? Because the quality and price for the sushi is unheard of! Excellent specialty rolls, high quality nigiri and sashimi and all for a very affordable price. Try everything you won't be let down!
Not over the top amazing like some people are commenting. Not in my opinion at least. And the wait....the sushi is definitely not worth it.

Amazing sushi at an incredibly cheap price!  Having lived in Hawai`i for 9 years this was a pleasant surprise to find in Charlotte.   The Poki (poke for the Hawaiians) is amazing as was every sushi roll we ordered.   

This place is small and PACKED.  The take out orders and queue for being seated are ridiculously large.  Go early (6pm) or plan to wait!  Or, order take out and arrive when it's ready, it'll probably be a better choice than showing up at 7:30pm any evening.

Oh New Zealand, I wanted to like you for so much more than your wine from Marlborough, especially after the drive to find you, but unfortunately a 3 star s all I can commit. The place is small and quaint and deserves the "cafe" name. The menu is extensive with pictures (not a fan of pictures food on a menu as a norm) and the prices are CHEAP, which is the best part of the place. 

Had some steamed pot stickers for an appetizer and while good, they could use a bit more flavor. Then ordered 4 rolls, most recommended, and they came out on a funky boat which was cool. They tuna crunchy roll was way too hot and fried for my taste. My favorite roll was the pink roll and would order it again and again. Ichiban and Dynamite roll were good too, though the Ichiban could have used something extra. 

All in all, the price is hard to beat and I will try it again when I'm in the area and try a few different rolls.

We randomly discovered the New Zealand Cafe in this little strip plaza at the corner of Sardis and Monroe and noticed that every time we saw it, it looked quite busy, even during weeknights.  We decided to give it a try one Wednesday evening and understood why.  

They have a pretty extensive Asian menu, including a wide variety of sushi.  We tried a tuna crunch roll to start and I literally could have eaten about 5 or 6 of those for my dinner and been completely satisfied (not to mention very full).  The roll was so full of flavor and only very lightly fried.   Nevertheless, I also ordered one of their hot chicken entrees, the spicy Thai curry chicken, too.  It came in a bento box with the chicken entree, rice, a few fried shrimp, dipping sauces, a salad with ginger dressing, and a crab cheese wonton.  All for under $6.  At dinner.  Wow.  It was VERY delicious and well worth the price.  

What a find the New Zealand Cafe was!  We'll definitely be back for a very reasonably priced, hot, delicious meal.  I can't wait to try more of their sushi and hot entree options!

This is my "go to" restaurant. I eat here at least once per week.  The food is consistently fresh and perfectly prepared.  In over 10 years, I've never had a bad meal here.  The staff is very friendly. I really love this place!!
We love NZ! The food is always outstanding and the sushi is always fresh and tasty. The prices are reasonable. Hidden gem!
YES. JUST YES. best sushi evvvveerrrrr. You can get an AMAZING philly role for just $5!!! Small seating so be ready to wait a bit on weekends. Very cool sushi bar that you can sit at!

Small spot, but they are cranking out some amazing dishes. I am a big fan of sushi. This restaurant has some of the best presentations and rolls in the city. The prices are great and so are the portions. Great food, great value, great service.
This place had great sushi at affordable prices. The fish was fresh and the rice had good texture. The place is small but the service is good.  I will definitely be back.

I was very confused when I first arrived not at all what I was expecting but my friend had been a few times and said it was good so I of course listened and met him there!

First off pretty small and we were lucky to get a table. I recommend to go on a not so busy time (meaning not 7-7:30) 

The food was pretty good we just did an assortment of rolls and some edamame and Pot Stickers. 

I was most impressed by the service they were very attentive and made some really good recommendations

Hands down, some of the best sushi I've had. I had the Rose Roll and the Discover Roll. My favorite was the Discover. The presentation for all of our sushi (my husband and I ordered 4 rolls between us) was beautiful. I will definitely be back!

Pro tip: This place is small, so I recommend arriving early for lunch or dinner! It gets crowded -and fast!

One of my favorite sushi places in Charlotte, actually the best in my opinion! The prices are reasonable for sushi and the taste is excellent. We come here often and wait it out since there is always a wait. If you do a pick up make sure to call in at least 30 mins before because it usually isn't ready even when you come in to pick it up. They are usually always packed but it is worth the wait.

Best sushi (and best prices) in the area. This is a must try for anyone wanting sushi in the area. The restaurant itself is TINY, and you will probably have a pretty decent wait for dine-in. We normally do take-out and have always enjoyed

I've had this place bookmarked forever. So I'm glad I finally got the opportunity to try it. 

We stopped by for dinner, when we arrived there was a 40 minute wait. It was worth it! 

I started with the vegetable spring rolls. They were pipping hot, crispy and delicious. For my meal I ordered the Discover Roll. Oh my goodness. It has all of my favorite things....spicy tuna, crab and avocado topped with spicy mayo! It was so good. It might be my new favorite roll. 

I can't wait to come back. There are so many more things that I'm looking forward to trying!
Great sushi. Place is small but service is good and prices are right. Huge selection of food options.
I have come to live this place! Sushi fresh and flavorful, affordable price with a cozy atmosphere. I have averaged a visit every week for the past 3-4 weeks.

Adjusted for location, being a sushi snob from Marin county, California, I'll go five stars.  
It is not quite as good as my favorite place back home but better than my second favorite.  
Everyone says it's the best sushi in charlotte and I believe them.   Had an excellent lunch.  Couldnt wait for dinner the night previous because it was packed.  And only reason I got in for lunch was I showed at 1130.  Go early.

After hearing about this place from a friend, and seeing it previously on Yelp, I decided to check it out for lunch today.
Though it was a little cramped, and the service a little scattered, the sushi was very good and reasonably priced.  With so many mediocre (at best) sushi places in CLT, it's nice to find a quality place close to home.  I will def. be back!
above average to good sushi at compelling prices. Service is....deliberate.

My wife and I have enjoyed dinner here several times and have never been disappointed. The sushi is excellent as well as the rest of the menu. The staff is extremely friendly and they make you feel welcome. The space is small but it doesn't distract from the New Zealand cafe, it adds to it. So go ahead give them a try, you won't regret it.

Hands down the best Sushi in Charlotte!  Very reasonably priced for what you get.  Big, fresh, super tasty rolls.  This place is small and you will have to wait- sometime a long time.  I promise it is worth it.  Try the rest of the menu other than sushi- everything is excellent.

Tucked away in a strip mall, this truly is a gem of a place! I'm not what you would call a sushi expert, but absolutely loved the valentine roll, spicy tuna roll and salmon skin roll we'd ordered tonight.

Prices are very reasonable and staff is very friendly. I wish the restaurant was a little more spacious, but thats not a major complaint.

I've been going to New Zealand Cafe since they opened.  (Can anyone remember when it was a Sub Dudes? Yea.. Still amazed at how much of the decor they kept--but I digress.)

New Zealand Cafe makes you think you're going to be eating Kiwi foods, but you're not.  I still don't quite understand the connection in that light but it is what it is.  Now if you're looking for a great and fair priced Bento Box, Sushi, or a spread of menu items that are all quite tasty and again well priced then you are in for a treat.  We've roamed the menu over the last few years and while I often get Sashimi bentos or some collection of Sushi rolls, when I am hungry I'll grab a roll and a entree and still feel like I made out great.

The service is interesting; sometimes we feel like we're coming home--sometimes we feel like we need to wave for a glass of water.  Just go with a bit of room in your flexibility for service.  This also includes patience.  This place has got to be no larger than 800sqft of sitting space which translates into a waiting game if you go any time near dining hours.  We will always go early, or go late, but never go during dinner rush.

If you don't like waiting, and you really need to be doted upon there are many places in Charlotte that will charge you waaaay waaay waaay more for the same quality of food.  I'd rather afford a healthy amount of great food than pay for a store owners overhead.  You're going to have to make that choice.

So if you want some great sushi and bento combos head on over.  Hell you even get a free meal on your birthday--now that rocks.

great food! I order the teriyaki chicken noodles and it's always delicious, their ginger salad is great and I love their rice with shrimp sauce! my hubs gets the queens town chicken. we love this place. it fills up quick and is on the smaller side but it's worth it
I love New Zealand Cafe... is by far no the best sushi in Charlotte, but is always fresh and good... it is such a great place to visit, that I will stop for a quick bite if I am in the area

First went there asked hostess if they we're busy and had a table available she said no they were not and yes there was tables available I told her I was waiting for someone she said okay and nothing else the person came less than three minutes later we walk into sit down mind you I have a baby and a toddler she says oh we don't have any tables available it's going to be a 30 to 40 minute wait she said someone just walked in   why didn't you take my name and hold the table when I walked in there!  okay besides that we decided to eat outside so we only had to wait 10 to 15 minutes we got our food it was okay not excellent not bad so we get home about two hours later I get the worst stomach pains and cramps I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning I was in the bathroom most of the night my husband who also ate chicken also had extreme pains and was in the bathroom most of the night my daughter didn't eat chicken she had sushi when she woke up in the morning she was vomiting we did not all eat the same things but we all had pretty much the same symptoms of food poisoning I only had breakfast that morning so it was nothing else that I ate and I had a bowl of cereal my husband was at work and my daughter ate her lunch at school that I packed for her so 100% positive it was the New Zealand Cafe just glad that the baby didn't eat there. He was the only one not sick. honestly I just don't think that they handle their food sanitarily probably cross-contamination with fish chicken not cooking things properly or just plain dirty or not keeping things at a proper temperature. If you have a sensitive stomach I suggest you don't eat there and find a cleaner nicer not so cramped seafood place
Pretty good sushi. I've only been there one but very solid. Really good service.its one of the best places in the area

This is the best place for sushi in Charlotte... there is no room for argument... this is a fact. I live about a quarter mile from New Zealand Cafe, but I didn't know about it until a coworker of mine recommended it. It took me a couple of weeks to actually make it over there, but once I did I was hooked! I have been there 3x so far. It can get really crowded for dine in, so be sure to expect a wait.. a wait well worth it. Carry-out is also an option I have done a few times.

The sashimi bento box was delicious. The fish is very fresh and they roll the sushi right in front of you. They have $1 nigiri which is phenomenal and very high quality. The prices here are cheaper then most places and the sushi is better tasting and higher quality. My favorite rolls are the spicy tuna and the tempura rolls. I have a lot more to try! 

5 stars
Great service! Plenty of choices. I wouldn't say five star sushi quality. However, the price and variety make it completely worth it!
I've only gotten sushi and some apps here. Definitely one of my favorite sushi places. Knocked off a star because there is always a wait. This place is tiny but worth it.

After completing my first dining experience at New Zealand Cafe, it's no wonder this place is so highly rated and raved about. It look's a little dive-y / hole-in-wall from the outside, but inside this place is a real gem. 

I opted to go with the bento box so I could get a little taste of everything. The hibachi chicken box ($12.99) came with chicken hibachi, white rice, a California sushi roll, ginger salad, 2 pcs shrimp tempura, and a few tempura battered/fried veggies. What a steal!

The chicken hibachi was full of flavor and veggies. The sushi was fresh & the ginger salad had a great taste. The other sushi I saw coming out of the kitchen looked awesome, so I'll definitely give that a try next time. A real sushi gem the Sardis area.
My coworker recommend this place. She was right! It's the best sushi that I have ever had.
Love love love the food!  It's the BEST! But I really get claustrophobic in such a tight and always crowded place. I hang in though because their sushi us incredible especially for the price.

Best sushi in town!!!!! I almost didn't post this review bc I love it so much, I don't want it to get any busier. But it's totally worth the wait. Great food, awesome service.  Definitely try the hot and sour soup if you like spicy. You can't go wrong with the sushi- it's all delicious.

I'm a regular at this place because of it great sushi rolls and onion soup. The other evening on my visit my spring roll was cold when u bit into it. I didn't cause a commotion just requested another one. The owner gets a attitude because I sent it back. She took it upon herself to be a waitress for the remainder of the evening. OMG the service was dry, we were RUSHED and she didn't apologize nor said thank you after returning with my receipt. I don't think I'll be returning...

Nothing special. They serve what most of the Americans call sushi. 
They make rolls with care, which was impressive.
The pictures on the menu looked disgusting and made me lose my appetite, though.

If you live close, it's convenient as Harris Teeter or Publix deli sushi.

I've cheated and swayed a few times but at the end of the day, New Zealand holds my heart. He has all of the qualities you would want in a lover: family-oriented, charming, comforting, original and dependable with a little unpredictable spice. He is simple, but knows all the way to please your palate. What more could a girl ask for?

I've sampled bits and pieces of the entire menu, but truly it is the sushi that retains me an addict, yearning for more. Despite the frequency of my visits, I still to this day have a hard time narrowing down conclusive favorites. There are so many innovative and delicious rolls on the menu that it always takes me the time length of 3 waiter/waitress visits before I decide. I do have one roll that I simply can not live without and that is the Century Roll! It comes with 8 pieces and 4 different "toppings" (2 tuna, 2 scallops, 2 crab, 2 octopus). The scallop pieces are what I live for! I also LOVE the Wasabi Salmon roll. It comes with this wasabi sauce that is creamy and oh so delicious! Plus, they have a $1 Nigiri/Sashimi menu! I recommend the spicy scallop, salmon, yellowtail and quail egg sashimi. They literally melt in your mouth because it's so fresh!  This is by far, one of the best gems in my treasure chest!

Oh New Zealand Caf√©, I really wanted to love you...but unfortunately, I found you to be "meh".  

When I walked in around lunchtime the other day, there were a good number of people in the small dining area, but there were quite a few tables open, so I was seated immediately.  

Unfortunately, when I walked in, the place smelled fishy, not good. Based on the smell of the place, I was a bit worried about how fresh the sushi was, so I decided to pass on that.  

Instead, I ordered a shrimp & chicken hibachi which was served "bento box style" with brown rice, salad, chicken skewers, and some sort of 'cheese-filled ravioli' (odd!).  The shrimp & chicken was ok, but was a bit too salty for my preference.  The brown rice was oddly flavored, a bit greasy, and cooked with corn or something odd like that mixed in (WTH?!). The chicken skewers consisted of 2 small skewers with oddly reddish looking chicken that was seriously dry & overcooked.  The cheese ravioli thingies were also odd tasting and not especially good. Sadly, the salad was drenched in some sort of yucky salad dressing.  Overall, I was very disappointed with the food. 

On the plus side, the food was pretty cheap, and service was pretty good.  I just wish the quality & flavor of the food was better.

New Zealand Cafe is the place to go for some outstanding food! I've been going here for years and it has never disappointed me. Everyone must try the Tuna Poki but instead of avocado replace it with cucumbers!

Years ago I was in this shopping center and I looked at New Zealand Cafe Sushi and I thought to myself that place looks like it would be sketchy.  It looked like it was a large space and would have a lot of televisions.  

Fast forward a couple of years, some good Yelp reviews and an invitation from friends, well maybe I should give it a chance.

The place is tiny, it has about 9 tables and 4 seats at the sushi bar with a bunch of televisions. Televisions are in the darndest places. The food is delicious.  There is more to offer than sushi, but I have only been twice and sushi is the only thing that I order.  I might go as far as saying it is my favorite sushi restaurant.  Every roll has been delicious, well, except for one. 

Tonight we ordered a California roll with tuna and the tuna was mushy on top, my husband said it was like cat food.  That was a bit disappointing, but not enough to make me deduct a star and certainly not enough to keep me from returning. 
My favorite roll tonight had diced jalapenos and it was burn the baby hot. It made me cry tears of happiness. Booooohoooooo.

I guess its true, you get what you pay for. Sometimes you get alot more then you paid for.

1st time I and my girl tried this place, The folks were very rude, but alas, we could put up with rudeness if the food is good.

We were both very far from being impressed. This was obviously not the freshest stuff...I luv sushi. I eat an awful lot of it, including on the boat with the Tuna's heart still beating (cant get better/fresher then that)

While not impressed at all, we gave it a 2nd shot. Went with another couple. All agreed it was not fresh with none of us impressed in the slightest.

But I guess we should be thankful that only 3 of the 4 of us got sick. Very sick. The only one who didnt get sick also loves sushi and after our extensive meal arrived, and being the expert he is, he chose to not even attempt to try it and ordered a chicken meal. While he wasnt impressed with it either, it was at least edible and he was the only one who didnt get violently ill. 

There will not be a third visit.

Food is great. A little salty for me, but I'm very sensitive to salt. So try it first! Sushi is great! I love the super Tom and tempura roll. Stuffed after! Very small space, so come early come hungry!!

The sushi is on point. I had been hearing about this place for a while. Had the chance to stop in for lunch. I ordered the Itchibon Roll, it was over the top good!
I have been back 3 times since. Great staff also, GO THERE NOW! !!!

This was, hands down, the best sushi I have ever had.  For that reason, it's no wonder locals tout New Zealand Cafe as having the best sushi in all of Charlotte!

The restaurant is a hole-in-the-wall in a somewhat dated strip mall.  It's very tiny with less than ten tables.  I went on a Saturday night and waited only two minutes before our party of two was seated at the sushi bar per our request.

Despite it's size and location, the sushi is absolutely delicious.

Kudos to my fellow Yelpers that drew me here. New Zealand Caf√© is a small, cozy sushi joint tucked away in the strip mall. What I like the most is their wide selection of both hot foods and sushi. 

Maybe it is the Japanese hospitality, but the servers were all extremely nice. 

For sushi, I had a tuna hand roll, tuna, Iidako (baby octopus), salmon roe and tamago nigiri. They all lived up to my expectations. On top of that, they even gave me an extra baby octopus! 

On the benzo side, everything was very standard, well-executed. I would highly recommend the black pepper steak. 

Overall it was a good experience, and I'll be back soon.
I returned again - and I still think this place rocks - their rolls are huge their sushi is good and even though its small and crowded the staff is very attentive.

Superb!!!!!!!!
Hands down the best sushi place in town. Outstanding service too. Now... because they are good the wait time can be a little longer (30-60mim) on the weekends but it is totally worth it. So so so....glad I found this place.  I also see a lot of takeout customers because of the wait time but that also tells me they do excellent food here.

We used to enjoy coming here, but the last couple times have been disappointing to say the least. We waited almost an hour to be seated on Tuesday night, after our order, we had to wait another 20 mins. I ordered the bento box which was supposed to come with a california roll. Everything was overfried, chicken was bland and the california roll was pitiful and tiny and looked like it was made by a 5 year old. I couldnt even call it a sushi. 
We decided to get a take out couple days ago, figured we's skip the wait this time. We ordered the season platter which was supposed to come with postickers, shrimp and egg rolls. The potstickers were extremely small, as well as the shrimps(they also tasted raw and not grilled as described). The "soy" sauce that came with it was just soy flavored water. I had to toss it. The bamboo sushi was also 1/2 the size of a normal sushi roll. Definitely not worth the $22. 
Looks like we'll have to look for another good sushi place

I want to give this place a bad review so people will stop going here so this place will be less crowded. But I think it's too late. Secret is out. This place is awesome.

Even though this place is very small and can be very crowded the wait for a table or food is never too long.

Sushi menu really delivers and the bento box are always a solid choice.

The dining space is a little bit small, but Jackie does phenomenal job with this restaurant. Make sure you get there early if it is a weekend evening. Been voted best in Charlotte many times and all you have to do is try it once to see why.

Great hole in the wall. I have been to many sushi places from NYC to Chicago even LA. This place is an awesome must try place. Very small cafe location but looks can be deceiving. Would highly recommend for someone looking for a casual dress sushi spot in Charlotte.

The food is good but the atmosphere is not so good. I think this is a good takeout place but I would not recommend if you're looking for a quiet, intimate or semi private dining experience. The tables are super close together and they packed 20 tables into a space designed for 10. 

Will try again when they expand.

A friend recommended this place otherwise we never would have found it. Dont let the strip mall location turn you off. Its a tiny hole in the wall but the sushi is amazing and almost as good as RuSans! It is now our go to sushi place almost weekly! Rolls are creative and delicious... Try the favorite roll -ironically my favorite roll! Salt and pepper calamari and lettuce wraps are are good starters. Also good yo go with people who are not sushi fans as their dishes are really good too. If you go on the weekend go early... Gets crowded and its small.

Great sushi place. Very small establishment, only 12 tables and can feel very cramped and over crowded. I will definitely come back, next time I will order my sushi to go instead of eating there. We waited about 25 minutes for a table for two and about 30 for our food. The sushi was delicious and tasted great.
I've eaten a lot of sushi and this place is great for the price! Family owned and a Charlotte staple for years!

I'm from Charlotte and can't believe I waited this long to try this place. I know it's been around for years. The sushi was delicious and so affordable! I came with friends and we all loved what we got. Service was great and we were lucky to nab the last big table during our visit.

Been three times. Steadily worse each time. Not another chance.
I expect frozen fish, this is Charlotte. I expect crowds, this place is tiny, and in a strip mall. I DON'T expect an hour to get 20 pieces of mediocre nigiri, even if it is on a nifty little boat. (Not sure how they are getting those CLEAN enough to eat off of, but hey, I don't work for the health department).  
It took 30 minutes to get two of us in, and 10 to get in an order. 30 mintes later, still just a beer, nothing else. Others around us just keep getting fed, we just sit. Better yet, when I have the audacity to ask what's taking so long, the waitress gets huffy and kept blathering that nigiri takes longer to make. Gee, I've never eaten sushi before, please guide me sensei.

Just admit that you screwed up somewhere. Cut the BS. Don't keep coming by and making excuses AFTER 30 MINUTES, 45 mintues, an hour.
Say something like it's on a slow boat...

30 minutes more, boat time. Ordered a small beer. Happy just to get my order in the end, but clearly some of it had been on the boat for some time. After saying so, one of the sushi chefs came out and apologized for the time taken and told me they would comp my second beer...so that's something, I suppose. 
$3.50 for an hour sounds more Chinese than Japanese, but I digress.
Two and a half hours I won't get back, and felt like a waste then and now, but maybe I can keep others from doing the same.
In sum, save your money and keep looking for better, it HAS to be out there.

Really excellent sushi selection - varied and delicious. This place is a tiny hole in the wall, but it is ALWAYS packed. The people are very polite and helpful. Non-sushi meals are delicious too! I get cravings for this place.

This place is a hidden gem! I had never had sushi before coming here, but I'm glad I made New Zealand my first stop! The sushi is so delicious and affordable- they even have $1 and $2 pieces. I recommend the Crunchy Eel roll or the H.O.T. Roll!

They also have different meals to choose from that you would find in a normal Chinese restaurant and you get a lot of food for the price- I recommend the Queen City Chicken- which is their take on sesame chicken.

If they're busy, seating is a little cramped because it is a small space, and it can get a little loud will all those people in such a tiny area. 

I've been several times and the food & service are always great! Definitely will be my go to sushi spot!

My friends and I stumbled on this place while in the area and looking for something to eat. This place was surprisingly good for a hole in the wall joint. I ordered a Big Boss roll and it was beautiful, fresh and delicious. The service was fast and curtious. I would recommend.

I am such a fan of New Zealand Cafe. My favorite sushi roll there is the Super Tom roll. It has shrimp and cucumber inside and shrimp and avocado on top. Simply delectable. I love it! 

Staff at this restaurant are very efficient and helpful. It never takes long for any food to arrive. I really have no complaints about New Zealand Cafe except that the restaurant is small. I wish they were able to expand, because some evenings there are so many people waiting outside for a free table. 

However, I usually try to get there before the crowd. Great food!

I had been looking forward to visiting this place after hearing how good the sushi was but I found the sushi to be just ok.  The place is quite small so timing is everything if you want to eat in.  I had the family chicken with mixed veggies, rice, salad, 2 shrimp, and 2 crab rangoons for $6.95, great deal for all that you get and it was pretty good.  I also had a crunchy lobster salad roll which looked great but it was way too chewy and the crunch was actually wet and mushy........yuk!  So, I'm not sure if that means the seaweed wrap was old or what but it was not cool.  The service was nice and friendly and it seems like a popular place but I doubt I'll return for a second visit.

This might be my new sushi go-to in Charlotte when I want some amazing sushi for great prices!  The restaurant is small and usually very busy so you have to wait for a table, but it is so worth it!  The sushi is fresh and so good and doesn't cost you an arm and a leg, which is a nice change from many other sushi spots around town.  We could see that many people take advantage of the take out also since the line looped around the restaurant for pick up orders.  We've already been back a few times since trying it and will keep going back for more!  Drink prices are very reasonable, as well!

Looking for fresh sushi? This is the place to go in Matthews. Fresh, tasty, generous portions. The staff, and owner, Jackie, are super friendly! It's always busy. And if you come in five minutes before closing, they're still eager to serve you!

We've only eaten here once so far but it was by far the best of all the sushi places we've tried since moving to the area. The rolls and sashimi we had were very good, my only complaint is the very crowded, tight space. We went early (5ish) which is fine with us but by the time we left it was a packed zoo. Not very enjoyable. If the sushi wasn't so good we wouldn't go back but it was so we will. Will def consider take out though and will continue our search for delicious sushi AND relaxing environment.

The best Asian food in Charlotte
I've been eating here for over 10 years. Their meals and sushi are awesome.

Sushi rolls

It is located in the Harris Teeter shopping center,next to the "Chinese Food" sign.
Tiny restaurant,the lightning is a little dark,limited seating and yes the tables are really close to each other. It feels a little uncomfortable. 
The sushi is really average, it taste like grocery store bought sushi,except it's not cold. Most of their rolls are deep fried. 
The quality of food and price are both lower compare to other sushi restaurants.
I would maybe just order take out from time to time if I'm feeling cheap and need a quick sushi fix.
Best sushi in town! Love it wish the place was bigger because there's always a wait list to sit down.. deff worth it though!

So its our anniversary and my wife would like to get some sushi....living in Matthews that can be difficult. I had seen the restaurant in the past but was not sure. WOW - a great venue for sure. Very small - close in tables for couples and medium sized groups - lots of attentive waitrons - and a nice menu for any tastes. We went with three big rolls that did not disappoint. The house Vino Tinto was good for the price. Folks were cutting up and talking and having an all around good time. The food was good - fresh and tasteful - but everyone else around us was the cinch!
Most amazing sushi in the Charlotte area. Truly creative, fresh and worth the wait. We go all the time!

Best sushi you will eat. Ask for the cilantro roll it's not on the menu. I'd have given a 5 Star but it's also the worst service you will ever get. For take out order 45-1 hr ahead. They tell you 30 minutes and it's never that. They're not the nicest people at the counter either so you just got to suck it up and know the food is phenomenal.
Very good food that is inexpensive. Nice to find a gluten free spot near the movie theater.
Best sushi in town. I recommend and send a lot of people and they feel the same way! Cathy and Jackie are awesome!
Always fresh here! Love the free birthday meal too! Small space so show up early if you want a table. Best to call in advance for take out too.
I absolutely love this place! The best sushi ever and even if someone isn't a fan of fish they have many other items to choose from. Excellent value!!

Great sushi but first time visitor's be warned. It is a very small restaurant. If you go during prime hours, you will be waiting a long time.
