It can also be very noisy and probably not the best choice for families with small children. That being said, go during non-peak hours with one other person and you can have a fantastic meal.
I've been sitting here for 1 hour and 25min and I just received my food. Great food, but order to go. They take priority in that.
One of my favorite places to order takeout!  Consistently great food. Don't judge it by the strip shopping center location. Fresh awesome Sushi and great service.

Strange name for a sushi joint! The menu said that it was actually a chain that offered Asian and New Zealand cuisines. I'm not sure which items were more New Zealand-esce because I mainly saw typically Japanese dishes/sushi options. 

After getting past the restaurant name and confusion, I was able to concentrate on their extensive menu. As their sign outside indicates, they offer some sashimi between $1-$1.75. In addition, they have a lot of rolls to choose from. I got the spicy tuna and veggie tempura rolls ($4.95 and $4.55). Very good! The pricing was great!

Like others have indicated, the space is small with seating for maybe 12 in the middle, 6 high/stool tables on the sides, and a sushi bar to fit 3 at the front. The service is okay, but lacked on refilling drinks. When you go, be assertive or you may go without. 

This location is in the Harris Teeter strip mall area. It's tucked away next to a nail salon. I wish it was closer to where I lived because I'm sure I would go here more often (I get sushi cravings regularly). If you love sushi, try this place...all of the previous reviews are right on!

The sushi here is amazing! I don't know what it is but its so delicious and I'm actually full after my meal. 
I'm a New Yorker and our sushi portions are so small its usually 6 pieces, not very filling. 
The atmosphere is nice and quiet. They even have seating outside and you can bring food out (you just have to pay first). 
The owner's really nice and friendly and clearly knows his stuff!

We called this restaurant before we got on the road to eat here because we had a 25 mile drive to eat here and had heard good things so we wanted to give it a try. I informed the lady we had 4 small kids and would be driving a good 25 miles to eat there so I wanted to see what the wait time was. She said they weren't too busy and it would only be about 10-15 minutes. We immediately left and drove the 25 miles and when we pulled up we noticed a huge crowd outside. I called the lady again and she again informed me it wasn't too crowded and would only be about a 15 minute wait. We got our kids out and got inside, and the hostess at the front said oh no the wait would be an hour or more. I said what? We just spoke with a lady and she told me differently. She said oh I'll have to let her know it's longer. They were very unsympathetic and could care less that we had 4 hungry kids and just drove 25 plus miles to only get turned around and find another place to eat! I am very appalled by how their customer service was and the lack of sympathy or apology. I will NEVER eat here. I understand we came on a Friday night, but all they had to do was tell us the real wait time and there would have been no issues! No matter how good a place may be, if there customer service is bad, it ruins their whole business!

This place has an amazing food, average customer service, cozy atmosphere. I had few issues with their sushi few years ago (which made me stop going there) but my recent visit changed my mind in a positive way again.
We love this place,  seating area is small so we don't usually order in.  We do alot take out and drive from Mint Hill.  Always good.

Stayed up the road and did a search for sushi.  Was concerned about the name but gave it a shot.  Small place, and no frills, but it was clear it was popular with all the people.  We got there at 5 and got lucky to get a seat.  A line formed soon after and lots of take out telling us it must be good.

Sashimi was good although slices were a bit small, and I prefer mine to be very cold.  Normally sashimi comes in 3 pieces per order and these were 1 per.  Rolls were excellent.  Everyone liked it and for where it is it was a nice surprise.  Again I prefer my sushi colder but it was tasty.  

Would definitely go back to try some other things.

Somebody PLEASE CLEAN THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!!!!

Absolutely disgusting, years of grime on the hallway walls, bathrooms, floors are corroding, rusted out doors. Really?? How is this place even open!!!!

I went here last night with a friend to try out a new Sushi restaurant. IT WAS EXCELLENT!! I'm a fan of Ru Sans, but the past couple of times I had been there much was to be desired....and it was noisy 9/10 times. The NZC is in a nice spot, and although the place is small, it's cozy and you can actually hear a conversation. The waitress was polite and tentative, as well as the greeter. The biggest thing though- was the Sushi. I had a ginger salad to start (yum), then the Vegetable Tempura Maki roll (yum) and sampled some of my friends crispy Tuna Maki roll- also yum. I found a new Sushi place to go- goodbye Ru Sans.

Eat here with your eyes closed. The decor isn't THAT bad but you certainly don't frequent New Zealand Cafe for its strip mall ambiance. Don't let the fake plants and cramped dining room scare you off. The food is at least fifty percent better than you would think.

Service can be a bit slow so grab an app. Rolls are fresh, varied (tons of non-fried options) and affordable. Four rolls at dinner with beers ran us about $37 before tax and tip. This is a great spot for affordable sushi or try the bento box for a little bit of everything.

I wish they had more outdoor seating -only two tables- but this place is the only place in the area with quality sushi. It is packed for a reason.

Wow.....all I gotta say is Wow. You wouldn't think driving around in Matthews that this random lil strip mall would provide amaaaazing sushi. But yes I did. A friend of ours who had discovered this sushi heaven decided to take us Charlotte newbies for a real sushi treat. Coming from NYC where good Sushi restaurants are a dime a dozen....I was a bit skeptical. I mean there isn't a true shoreline here in Charlotte. How fresh can the seafood really get? very very fresh is the answer. The restaurant itself is very homey and the service is always polite and fast. The sushi chefs themselves are a bit very slow. Probably because its a father son duo doing their thing. But the wait is worth it. We ordered like 8 rolls and the 3 of us ate and ate till we couldn't eat anymore. the menu is extensive and well priced. But the sauces were the real winners for me. Most of the specialty sushi rolls come with this amazing spicy sauces and they are just divine. I didn't care for the rolls with roe in it because it was a bit too fishy for me. But the rest of the rolls were rocking ;o) Definite try for all sushi snobs and sushi virgins too :o)
This place is great!!!! Never had bad service. It's very small but makes you feel cozy

One of my favorite places in Charlotte, my personal choice for quality food and sushi at a cheap price, and I bring all out-of-town visitors here.  While their special rolls may be priced in the $10-13 range, standard rolls like spicy tuna run about $4, and my personal favorite, the Super Spicy Roll is $6.  

If you're in the mood for more filling fare, the bento boxes are the way to go, as they come with entree, salad, rice/noodles, and a small side item - all for $6.  My favorite is the Thai Curry Chicken, but I have tried almost all entrees on the menu and haven't been disappointed.  

My only complaint is that this place is small, with only 10-12 tables, so there is almost always a wait.  and, when they are particularly busy, it can be a little while before your food comes out.  but it is worth the wait, and like someone said before - thats a perfect time for a beer.
SO SO SO good! The sushi is always fresh & delicious and the wait staff is super friendly! Great sushi for spicy food lovers!
Best sushi in charlotte. They also have a great selection of gluten free options. Ask for the gluten free soy sauce.

New Zealand Cafe is a small sushi and Asian cuisine restaurant tucked away in a small strip-mall near Matthews. The sushi is always super fresh, the rolls are creative, prices are a steal and above all the food is delicious.  If i lived closer i would be here at least twice a week. Easily. It's that good.
The space itself is pretty small so more times than not there is a wait to be seated. They do a decently paced turn-over on the tables though so its usually not too long and it is totally worth it.  To kill time I usually grab a menu and to read so when im in i am ready to order.
Everything i have ever had at New Zealand Cafe has been great! Ginger salad, miso soup, apps. noodles, chicken entrees, seafood entrees, sushi... all soooo good! The sushi is outstanding. Some of the best in town.  If you order enough of it it they will put it on a boat for you. Know someone who doesn't appreciate a good sushi boat? Well, their entrees are awesome too. For around $6-10 the entrees include- the protein (ex: Mango Chicken, Teriyaki Chicken etc) , rice or noodles, a house salad and then 2 of the following: chicken skewers, fried shrimp, crab rangoon. That's 5 items for as little as $6 and no they don't skimp on the portion size either. There will most likely be left overs to take home. It's almost hard to believe how good of a deal these meals are.
If your ever in the area, or hell-even if your not, I suggest a trip to New Zealand Cafe. It will not disappoint!

New Zealand isn't the quickest place to get sushi, their restaurant is very small and compact, and it's seemingly always crowded from open to close. I've waited thirty minutes or more several times, but once you sit down and enjoy your first bite, you realize why they're so popular. It's easy to tell the chefs at NZ have a passion for what they do, the sushi is fresh, clean, flavorful, and has great texture. Just trust me and your fellow Yelpers, if you like sushi and you live in Charlotte, this is your place. 

I recommended NZ to a couple friends who never tried sushi, and had them try the eel and shrimp tempura rolls, a mild, safe bet for a sushi first timer. Of course they loved it, but I was surprised when they devoured the mackerel nigiri. I'm so grateful that I live near NZ, but if I didn't, I'd go a few miles out of my way if I had that hard to satisfy sushi itch, and once you try NZ, you just may too!

Maybe I caught them on a bad, but their reviews do not match my experience. Sushi was not fresh and service was dull. I will give the waitress props for jacking my tip, I paused while putting my change in my pocket and she scoop my left over change about a 25% tip

The only reason why I'm giving New Zealand Cafe four stars is because of the space. The owners should just buy both buildings on either side of them, knock down the walls, and expand! It's just too small!
Other than that, everything is wonderful. The waiters are polite. The food is great. Even the ambience is pleasant. It's just too small. If they would deliver, that would make everything a whole lot better.

I love New Zealand. Only downfall is it is always so crowded you can barely breathe. I wish the place was bigger. Their food is reasonably priced. Sushi is great and so is their garden salad with ginger dressing.

Never had sushi and never been to NZC. Food was amazing and atmosphere is great too. Really small hole in the wall, but truly great food. People were lined up to be seated as it's a very crowded eating area. Will be back soon!

You know there was a time when I didn't like sushi but this place really sets the bar high when it comes to the sushi.  I took a friend here last night and was impressed by Cathryn's knowledge, empathy and customer service while she took care of us.  The d√©cor and design could use a revamp.  They are usually quite cramped here just because of all the business they receive.  I will say their machine accepts Apple Pay, Android Pay, Samsung Pay, Microsoft Wallet and other NFC compatible payment services BUT GOOD LUCK getting the manager that usually runs the register to let you attempt to use it.  I was successful but she was like next time bring your card.  I won't be bringing my card because I never carry it on me so if they won't accept my method of payment which literally every other merchant will accept or at least attempt to accept then I won't do business at your establishment.  This is no reflection on Cathryn's service as she was trying her best to get it to work and was a star for hospitality and customer service.  You get a very decent amount of food here.  I was full and had to take the rest home.  This place really makes great food and fresh sushi.     

If I have cash I may stop back by otherwise if they don't want to let me pay how I want guess I can't eat there
For visiting From California and looking at the reviews! Don't be fooled by the appearance of the Strip mall... always trust your instincts, worst sushi and terrible service

So great! I recommend the Crab and Asparagus Roll. Everyone at the table agreed that it was outstanding. The other rolls that we tried and recommend are the Big Boss Roll, the Crunch Roll Max, Dynamite Roll, Firecracker Roll, and Sweet Dragon Roll. Don't forget to get some potstickers for your appetizer. They are also excellent. The red bean ice cream was yummy.  The fried banana dessert was ok but nothing special.

I am always pleased with this establishment. Portions are great. Service is fast. Prices are good. Fish quality is good. Rolls are tight and keep together. Roll size is large but not too large for your mouth. Great carry out and nice relaxed atmosphere for dine in. There is one middle aged skinny Asian waitress that will rush you for your carry out or dine in order so if you get her be warned. The other staff is fantastic. The middle aged sushi chief has been there forever and knows what he is doing. Be sure to tip him and look for his big thankful smile and genuine gratitude while he nods in courteous gesture.
Awesomeness! My only dislike is this place is tiny and so popular. Get here early so you don't have to wait. Other than that....OMG amazing!

Great sushi. I'm obsessed with their tempura veggie roll! i've tried many others and have not been disappointed yet. Their entrees are alright, the best that i've had is their Chili pepper shrimp and that packed some serious heat. Their crab ragoons which they call crab cheese raviolli is disappointing and lacks flavor as well as substance. But if your looking for take out sushi this is your place, you can stay and eat but they are usually pretty busy and are tucked in a small space in a strip mall off monroe rd. and can get loud and crowded.
By far the best spot in Charlotte for sushi! Great prices mixed with great service. I don't understand how anyone could be disappointed.

The sushi here is great and I have been here many times but the last time I went the service was the worst I have ever experienced. Multiple people including myself were waiting on food for HOURS. After our appetizer it took 45 minutes for our food that wasn't cooked (sushi) to come out. Another note is that the restaurant was dead so it made no sense to take that long. I will never be coming back here I will take my business somewhere else. No one checked on us, apologized, nothing. Horrible service.

My one complaint about this place is that it's too far from my home :(  I used to live closer and this is my favorite sushi in Charlotte by a long margin.  They are super consistent with their quality.  I've tried most of the major sushi players and there are others that are great at times, but they just don't have the consistency.  If you love sushi and you haven't been here, make it your next destination and you'll be impressed.  The place is small, and it's not fancy.  They deserve to be on a wait every night.

New Zealand Caf√© came highly recommended by friends and neighbors around town. Labeled as "a hidden gem of Charlotte," my expectations were set. I was ready to be wowed. I decided to make the 30 min trek out to Matthews to give this place a try. When I arrived, it was very crowded and we had a 30-45 min wait which seemed normal at a place with so much hype around it. Once we were seated, we ordered 2 rolls of sushi and toro nigiri. The sushi was very salty and had no flavor. I remained hopeful as we still had their infamous sushi boat on the way. Once the boat arrived, it was the same thing. Salty, no flavor, not fresh. This place was extremely disappointing. Not only was it under average sushi, it was the same price, if not more than some of the better sushi restaurants around Charlotte. New Zealand Caf√© is great for people who are not regular sushi eaters. Anyone who knows good sushi, is better off going to Jade or Ru San's. Also, be prepared for the dining experience to take at least 2 hours (even on a Sunday).

New Zealand Caf√© is my go to place for Sushi for the past 8 years. They have never disappointed me in the quality of their sushi, taste or service. I love their cozy interior. Sometimes the wait is long, but there is always to-go available and they are always right and quick. They are amazing there! If you don't know what to get or are new to trying sushi the sushi chefs take very good care of you with their selections. They have other entrees available for the non-sushi lovers, but everyone that hasn't liked sushi, I have converted here. That is saying a lot! Love New Zealand Caf√©!!!!

New Zealand was recommended to us by a friend and we are so happy it was. Hubs and I visited here a couple years ago and then went again recently with friends, and it's still amazing.

Don't judge a book by it's cover - the place is small and it's located in a strip mall, but it's one of the best sushi places in Charlotte. Depending on where you are located, it's a bit of a drive, but again, worth it. The inside is small but it's clean and cute. The staff are knowledgable and skilled; our waitress took our order for 4 people and didn't write anything down. Impressive!

The menu is diverse and they have bento boxes and other authentic dishes besides sushi. The variety of rolls is awesome and they are always FRESH. The prices are very reasonable too - 6 sushi rolls and a bento box costs us $58. This place is definitely a hidden gem!

This is one of my favorite places to eat. I've been coming here for years! The food is great and you can't beat the prices. The place is pretty small so it's always crowded but it's worth it for the food that you get.

Got there at 5:50pm, waited 50 min for a table (was told 20) and then waited 1hr 10min for food. Crazy. Luckily I had nothing better to do. Ha! Almost nobody in the restaurant had food, yet it seemed that there was a steady flow of take out orders going out. This is not the first time this has happened while I've been here either. I guess I'll never understand why they don't suspend take-out orders while there are lots of tables sitting with NO FOOD for extended periods of time. That said, the sushi is great and the price is fantastic. I'll stick with going for lunch in the future.

Kind of glad i wasn't the first one to give it 3 stars. i did really dig this place for making a cool little restaurant in a standard looking strip mall. It was quite a trek out there for us, but looking at 20+ reviews of only 4 and 5 stars was convincing. 

Not being a huge sushi eater, i went with the H.O.T. rolls and something i knew i'd enjoy in the buffalo shrimp dinner. For non-sushi fans, the H.O.T. rolls really don't have any sort of gross sushiness to them, so a good choice in that respect. They didn't wow us all that much though. The buffalo shrimp came with rice, a salad and two sticks of chicken. The rice and shrimp were good and the salad was decent with a couple cucumbers, but the chicken on a stick was like something you find on a Chinese buffet.

My wife, the reason i frequently end up at sushi places was happy with the prices, but didn't think the sushi stood out from others (Nikko or Edomae) . She ordered the rainbow roll and the bagel roll. The rainbow roll didn't seem to have all that great quality of fish, some of it was chewy. The bagel roll was like a ground salmon that didn't have the typical salmon flavor she was expecting from sushi. 
She's still convinced that the quality of Nikko's sushi is still superior.

Aweful.  Worst sushi I have had anywhere.  The sushi is thin and skimpy and the other dishes were so terrible. I could tell the other patrons have not had real sushi.  It's cheap and the reason there are so many great reviews.  Quantity not quality here.
Wonderful sushi at a good price. Only negative was the overcrowded nicely decorated, clean, but small dining room without a decent waiting area on a cold night. Still five star food and service.

I've been to New Zealand Cafe several times and have never been disappointed with their sushi or service. In fact, this is probably the best sushi I've ever had. It is, by far, the best sushi in Charlotte (Yes, better than Cowfish). You can't go wrong with any of their specialty rolls. Love the christmas roll

This place is snappy, fresh and has awesome customer service!

Every time I've been here around 6pm or later durring the week I've been seated very quickly.

I've gotten the Crispy Tuna Roll, Volcano roll and the New Zealand Chicken a couple times. All thier food is of very high quality and tastes fresh. 

The host, servers and all of the sushi staff are very nice, accommodating, and are very knowledgeable about the menu. 

You will not be disapointed. This place is so good and is a almost a hidden gem!
Delicious sushi! Great service. Most likely, best sushi in town. My husband and I go there very often

We went based on what we had heard and read on Yelp. I'd have to disagree on the 'best' in town. Until the food was served, everything matched the positive reviews. There was a line. It was small and quaint. 
I order two different rolls. I think one I ordered was a H.O.T. Roll which was described as spicy tuna, cream cheese, with jalape√±o and lightly battered. The tuna tasted like it was from a can.  The other roll was a safe order meaning that it is a roll you could get anywhere and it would meet expectations.
I think, with anything, you must try a place for yourself to make your own judgement. Service was friendly but the food was nothing to get excited over. It's not a place I would be excited to try again.

I've been here many times so after having a bad experience I naturally wanted to try it again and make sure it wasn't just an off night. I tried it 3 more times and all were bad, the quality of the sushi has definitely diminished. The sushi smells really fishy and it doesn't taste fresh. The last time I tried it I got really sick. 

Rolls I've had: Big Boss, Crunchy, Supper Spicy and Charlotte Roll. 

I am really disappointed as this was one of my favorite sushi places :o(

This people are so nice I hate to leave it on that sour a note. The place is great, the service is great.  Please, pretty please find a better chef and raise dinner prices accordingly. Trying to serve a complete quality dinner for $6.95 today is ludicrous.

We were just in the Charlotte area for a night after an event. This was recommended to us and near where we were staying.  Glad we went! I had the Toro nigiri and a salmon dish. My bf had a chicken dish. The nigiri was SO good. The other food was good as well. I'd go back if in town again. Plus the prices are very reasonable. We thought it must be the lunch menu prices at first.

This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Charlotte. They have an amazing selection of all different types of sushi and Asian inspired dishes. The restaurant itself is on the smaller side so there might be a wait if you come with larger parties. Prices are unbeatable, sushi is amazing, service is great..what more can you ask for? NZC definitely delivers.

I was skeptical about all the rave reviews of NZ Cafe's sushi. But they were spot-on correct! Best sushi I've had in the Charlotte area. Very fresh. Balanced flavors and textures. Also loved the seaweed salad. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. The tiny place was packed with a happy, friendly crowd. My new go-to place for Sushi.

Stuck alone in a new city driving around looking for a place to enjoy my lunch hour, a sign caught my eye in a strip mall.  New Zealand?  My mind flashed back to my college trip to the Kiwi Isle.  Back then I was determined to eat something New Zealand other than the fruit.  Everytime I asked where a good "New Zealand style" restaurant would be I ended up directed to a mediocre Chinese buffet.  Sorry, New Zealanders that is from China; the Maoris did not invent General Tso's chicken.  Perhaps my culinary quest was at an end.  I pulled in to the boring suburban strip mall and 'Sushi bar' was stenciled on the windows underneath.  Slightly disappointed I decided to give it a whirl anyway, though a bit skeptical that sushi in a southern suburb might resemble that in a King of the Hill episode that was derived from canned tuna.  Opening the door however I delighted to see a very tastefully decorated and quaint interior with what looked to be actual Asians and not disguised Mexicans.  I, of course, tried the local Charlotte roll which was an Avocado on top style, my favorite.  It was delicious.  I'm quite pleased with my strip mall gem.

Update: Since eaten here around a dozen times.  I've tried tons of their specialty rolls.  My favorites were the:
HOT Roll - jalapeno, spicy tuna, cream cheese!
Ichiban Spicy Roll - Spicy Tuna, Crab, Avocado, red sauce
Bombing Roll - Fried in mint leaf
Wasabi Salmon Roll (w/ out mayo, eeg) - it's beautiful
Rainbow Roll - Even more beautiful and delicious

Also, good is the fried banana 'sushi' (which is more than enough for one person), the red bean ice cream and the really good service.  It was a sad goodbye my last week there eating 5 times.  Thanks everyone there!

Amazing!  Jackie never ever let's me down.  Ive eaten hear at least 50 times and it is always excellent.  I east sushi all over the country and this is some of the best I've found stateside.  

Tip:  ask for a spicy smoked salmon skin hand roll.  I eat two to three each time.  

Don't bring a large group but do bring patience as they are busy EVERY day during lunch and dinner.  Worth the wait!

The food is good but the service is so slow. The restaurant itself is tiny so the time it takes for food to be made & brought to your table is ridiculous. Out last visit it took the waitress almost 15 minutes to bring us water and our food took over an hour. Once the food arrives it wasn't prepared as we ordered it. 
I noticed they do a heavy amount of take out and people were complaining  about their takeout orders taking over an hour. 
Management needs to get a new business plan in place because if they don't this place will lose its popularity and close down.
Don't let the name (or the strip mall) fool you. It's really a diamond in the rough when it comes to sushi places. Once you try it I guarantee you will go back for more.

There's a reason it's cramped and the service is sometimes a bit slow.  This is the best sushi for the price in a hundred miles.  I would love for the place to move close by but to a larger location but that is really our only complaint.  We have always had fresh delicious sushi here.  We also have young children and have been surprised more than once by an impromptu dessert of free sliced oranges for them sent over by Jackie the lead chef.  If you want to go to Center City and pay $10 for a California roll be my guest but the sushi here is worth the wait.

The sushi may be great, but I will never know because my husband and I left after waiting for our food for almost an hour.

Very small place with no ambience and takeout orders seem to receive priority status. If you cannot serve your in house customers you should really stop accepting phone in orders at some point.

My boyfriend likes this place a lot better than I do. But he likes sushi, and I don't. 

Very crowded when we went, ended up ordering our food for takeout. It was evident that people loved this place over the Chinese restaurant next door. 

I had the mango chicken, wish it came with more chicken and less mango. Hated the rice. Boyfriend loved his two huge sushi rolls but I forget what they were called. 

Not sure I would go back unless he begged me to get sushi, but I am glad we tried someplace new.
The place is always packed, and for a good reason. The NZ Cafe offers some amazing sushi for a affordable price. You won't leave disappointed. I have tried the Philly roll and I loved it.

Had take-out from here the other night... We were in the mood for sushi, read the reviews on Yelp and just decided to go for it. We weren't disappointed. 

I can't comment on atmosphere, (as we had take-out and my significant other picked it up.  I still haven't seen the place, but I am familiar with where it is. 

We had an order of edamame, and 4 maki rolls (Crispy Bagel, California, Crispy Spicy Tuna, and Crab Cream Cheese Avocado) as well as an order of their garlic noodles. Everything was delicious aside from the noodles... yuck. Won't bother with those again. 

The sushi was fresh and fabulous. We'll definitely be back, at least for take-out! Yum!!

There is not a lot of seating so come early or be patient. It will be worth it. All food is prepared fresh. Sushi bar right up front with nothing to hind. Hot food comes out from the back. The best deal are the bento type meals. They include a whole  meal.

THE BEST SUSHI ROLLS IN CHARLOTTE. Having in mind that sushi calls for horse, cow and fish, ( THE FIRST TWO YOU ARE NOT GOING TO FIND IT HERE)this is , if not the best, a great place to indulge yourself  eating this beautiful asian dish!!

I'm not really sure where the name fits in, but New Zealand Cafe has great Asian food. I admit, when we pulled up I struggled to put aside my preconceived notions about strip mall restaurants. The Yelp reviews looked pretty decent and my companions swore it was safe. I didn't get any sushi, but the sushi my companions ordered looked good (and it came out on a cool wooden boat!) I ordered the Queenstown's chicken entree which came with 2 fried shrimp, brown rice, 2 crab Rangoon patties. All that food for around 6 bucks! Great value! The chicken was crispy and battered then covered in sweet & sour sauce. It was really good. We were seated at a 4 person high-top as we arrived. The restaurant was kind of small, so I imagine it gets crowded quickly. Service was good, lunch was pretty cheap all around a great experience.

I really wanted to love this place, but it just didn't happen-at all. We got a to-go order of "potstickers", snow crab/shrimp roll, and a salmon tempura roll. We were told it would be ready in 20 minutes on a Sunday (about 8:30 P.M.)
     To start, the place is like a broom closet. As you walk in, the register is at the far end of the restaurant - with literally 2 feet between the counter and the drink stand. While waiting in line to pay, we had to maneuver around the 2 foot space 3x for the wait staff. 
     The chefs didn't even begin to make our order until 10 minutes after our 20 minute arrival time. After paying, we moved to stand by the hallway to the restrooms, still seemly in the way of everyone- it was very uncomfortable. On to the food:
     The salmon tempura roll was a sad sight, but tasted okay. The crab/shrimp roll: the shrimp and avocado were fresh, but the crab looked like little hairs and was poorly represented. The "potstickers/gyoza" were a pathetic excuse for their name. They were mushy and bland. Even the dipping sauce served with them was a pale representation of what it should have been. 
     I know of many others that are much better than this place. They can serve 1$ sushi all day long, but I'll never come back.
This is hands down the best sushi in Charlotte. Get the boat! You get an amazing amount of sushi for a great price. The only downside is the wait--the restaurant is SMALL.

Have only done takeout here but a great experience! This place is always swamped and there is a line out the door, for good reason. The sushi is all very fresh, the rolls are inventive and the price is awesome! It's hard to beat $1 sashimi, and $5 for dynamite rolls. 

On a related note, my kids love their ginger orange chicken, and it really is good!

Just wanted to write a quick update - I am still crazy in love with this place. However, I've updated my favorite rolls - I am currently completely head over heels for the Big Boss roll and the Crunch Roll Max. I've tried almost all of the specialty rolls, and have really loved every one. I have noticed that they've been busier, so even lunch is packed now. For good reason. You can't go wrong here. And please let me know when you're going :)

I decided to come here thanks to all of the raves on Yelp and I kind of regret that now.
 
My friend and I showed up around 5:00 on a Friday and we were able to walk right in and grab the last of two tables. As everyone has already mentioned, it's very small inside. There are six high top tables and then about four to five standard tables in the middle.  We were originally at one of the lower tables but a party of four consisting of small children came in and we were kindly asked to move to a high-top table. We weren't disappointed with that at all. The high top tables afford you some conversational privacy.

I ordered a glass of the plum wine (which was delicious) and then placed my order for a rose roll and vegetable tempura roll. The menu is not only sushi-focused, there are also bento box combos, fried rice, teriyaki chicken and steak, etc.

Our food arrived and it was decent although my rolls were wider than expected. What I will say about the sushi is that this is a good place to bring sushi newbies. They provide a lot of tempura options as well as rolls with mayo/cream cheese. The rose roll I ordered consisted of spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, cucumber and cheese sauce on the side. I didn't have any of the cheese sauce. The vegetable tempura consisted of fried broccoli, sweet potato, and zucchini.

The waitresses were great, friendly, and super willing to accommodate any needs. After we were done with our food, my friend and I both agreed that we've had better sushi.

Unfortunately, hours later (in the wee hours of the morning), I was struck with sharp stomach pains that led to me having to spend some time near a toilet bowl. I didn't have anything else to eat that night after leaving New Zealand Cafe so I'm utterly confused as to why my body reacted the way it but, needless to say, I won't be going back to find out.

I will begin by stating that I am far from a sushi connoisseur. I have been to some fine sushi places (nobu etc, cldc in Barcelona) etc. 

I got the lobster avocado shrimp roll and my date got the "master roll" 

The rolls very honestly very good and delicious. I especially liked the master roll. 

The reason I am giving it 3 stars is because the service is abysmally slow. 

The sushi took at least 45 minutes to get here. 

It took at least 10 minutes for the server to get my check back to me after I placed my card in the card holder. 


These wait times are simply unacceptable. This place could be even busier but they need to get the turnover higher.

Since I'm review #259, I'll keep it short-ish. The fella is a serious sushi-lover, and after the numerous places he's eaten, he still thinks Musashi in south Charlotte is the very best when it comes to sushi. After our first trip to New Zealand Cafe (thanks to Yelpers' suggestions), it just leap-frogged to No. 2 of all time. 

We started with the steamed pot stickers, which were fresh and delicious. I'm not a sushi eater, so I appreciated that they had other options. I got the chicken bento box, which came with chicken and broccoli in a delicious, homemade brown sauce, two fried shrimp, two crab rangoons, brown rice, and a salad. I also appreciated that they offered me a fork! He got a special roll - the Bamboo  - along with a few pieces of Nigiri. There weren't as many pieces in the Bamboo roll as he hoped, but that was the only bad thing about it. 

Service was outstanding, and since they were even more packed than usual and running a little behind, they brought us complimentary edamame. The only negative thing I can say isn't even their fault - their food is so delicious and their space is so small that it was a 30-minute wait at 5:30 on a Saturday with hardly anywhere to stand inside on a cold day.

New Zealand Cafe is a treasure hidden in an old strip mall.  The food is good and inexpensive -- a great combination, in my book.  Sushi is one of those things I am always hesitant to order (although I usually enjoy it once I do), so I have yet to try any of NZC's offerings in that area.  However, their bento-box esque dinners are delicious.  For $6-10, depending on your selection, you get the main entree, two chicken skewers, two crab rangoons, rice, and a salad.  It's hard to beat that value, especially when it tastes so good.  I especially recommend the Fantasy Shrimp (with a unique, delicious fruity mayonnaise sauce) or the Crispy Scallops.

The only reason I New Zealand Cafe doesn't get 5 stars is because the inside is cramped, which means that the lines can be long and the dining crowded if you don't feel like take out.

Best sushi.  Great staff!  Love this place.

It is small, so, you go during peak dining hours, be prepared to wait.  It's worth the wait!

My fiance and I absolutely love New Zealand Cafe, a hidden gem in a less than stellar strip mall (with a name that sounds like it has nothing to do with sushi). It is some of the best sushi we have ever had at prices half as much as most other restaurants ($7-11 for a roll versus $12-16 elsewhere, for example). With that being said, we no longer actually eat at NZ Cafe. The restaurant is TINY. As in, I hope you want to have dinner with the strangers sitting next to you because you'll be on top of them and vice versa. Also, with only a few tables in the restaurant (maybe 10 tops), on busy weekend nights you might find yourself waiting for up to an hour. Once you're seated, the service is typically great (friendly, cordial) albeit slow as molasses so don't expect this to be a quick trip. One dine-in experience took about two and a half hours from start to finish.

As a result of the less than stellar dine-in experience, my fiance and I order takeout regularly instead. We call ahead (well before we are hungry because take-out can take a while, too) and pick up our sushi to enjoy at home. They have a nice variety and it is great quality as well. I would highly recommend this place for sushi takeout any day.
Small but worth the wait. Yes there are all your traditional sushi items on their menu but then there are some real gems. Unexpected, and crazy delicious. I wish it was closer for us...

So we were a little skeptical about eating at what yelp advertised as a one $ sushi place but I must admit we were impressed when we sat down. The food is awesome and the ambiance is pleasant. Definitely a new favorite!!!
Can you say over-rated?? The sushi, food, and service is all subpar. I've had much better sushi in this city without waiting 30 minutes for a table

I've been coming here for years. I love their food - Asian-style, "fusion," even. If you come at peak dining hours, be prepared to wait. It's a "cozy" joint, but well worth the wait. The sushi is ALWAYS superb, and there's always a chef's special of the day to try. There's a variety of Asian beers and sake to try (and I love hot sake). Everyone is very friendly and the service is fast (although, they get very busy at times, especially on the weekends, which can affect the speed a little). Everyone I know, who's been here loves this place.

We've only been in for sit-down twice, and carryout from a friend, once, but every time the experience, and food, has been just marvelous. Or last trip in November for our son's birthday was a party from the get-go. We had 2 ladies waiting on us - I think the hostess Sunny (who wanted to hang out with us after her shift! haha), and our waitress whose name, unfortunately, I didn't recall. But she was amazing! So funny and pleasant and sassy. A perfect accompaniment to our fun gang. She could easily do stand-up. I'm remiss in writing this review earlier because I really wanted to compliment them. I'm not ever sure what we ate (or drank) but I can guarantee it was delicious. If you have to wait to get a table, it's worth it.

This place has been one of my favorite resturaunts for over 10 years. Good quality sushi at great prices. They are always packed so you know they are doing it right. They are also very creative and come up with their sushi rolls. Jackie (head sushi chef) does a great job of crafting his own rolls. Also, go for one of their Bento Boxes as well. Generous portion and it comes with a lot of items for a good price.

Never enjoyed sushi before, but wife loves sushi, heard this place has some of the best sushi so took the Wifey for a date night.  They did not disappoint! Really enjoyed it, really small inside but nice setup, and food was great.  Started with the chicken lettuce wraps which were awesome then we had some spicy shrimp tempura rolls, now that's some sushi I can get into! Glad we finally discovered this place..will be back for sure

This place has amazing sushi. It's a very small place, so I would probably recommend getting takeout and eating at home. We have only ever eaten there 1 time, and it took awhile to get a seat. 

Call ahead and order take out, and bring it home. I usually order the dynamite roll (which is only like $6), and a few others. Easily some of the best sushi in Charlotte.

The menu is huge!!! Tons of rolls! The prices are from 10 years ago! Everything was awesome! Hidden little jem!!! Very fresh inexpensive sushi. Bummed it took me this long to find it since it's 100 yards from my office.

I'm not sure how we discovered this place but I am soooo happy we did!
It's located in a strip mall kind of place but as others have said, don't let that stop you. 
They offer some of the best sushi I've had any where! It's also super affordable! Their rolls tend to be larger than what I've had but so delish! New Zealand also offers some original rolls (or at least new to me).
It is a small restaurant so don't be surprised if there's a wait. It's worth it! 
The staff are quick, efficient and friendly. 
New Zealand Cafe is in our list of must visits when we are in the area!

Decent sushi but Im a bit weird when it comes to feeling comfortable in spacious settings and this place is way too tight for my taste.  Service was fine and so was the food (nothing to write home about) but I felt that I had about 10 people who I did not know all on my table because its so tight together.

We took a drive to check this place out after hearing about it from friends.  It is extremely affordable when it comes to sushi, hence the 4 stars.  The sushi was good, not amazing, but again, we didn't spent the normal $80 for two people which usually happens with my sushi-obsessed husband.  The best deal here are the meals!  For $6.95 you get your meal (we got chicken teriyaki) which includes actual chicken breast and fresh veggies, rice, salad and two small fried appetizers.  It's served on this giant tray- great value for the money!  If we are in the area we'd go again, but not driving the 20 minutes again.

New Zealand is one of the first restaurants I ever visited in Charlotte. I ate there before I even moved into town officially. 

And no, I'm not sure why it's called New Zealand, as it's clearly a sushi joint...but it's a GOOD sushi joint, and the prices are really good. I've eaten at a few sushi places around Charlotte, and New Zealand is one of my favorites.

I might not be the best sushi evaluator, as I won't eat anything that had a mother. However, I've never eaten anything bad at New Zealand, and I've frequented the place with pleased meat eaters several times. 

My favorites are the seaweed salad and the edamame. They've got some interesting desserts, like the red bean and green tea ice cream. I kind of like the tall tables, too...

One day, I'm going to order one of those giant sushi boats!

Love it! Excellent place even on a Tuesday night at non-peak time every table was full. Went there a few weeks ago and the two girls serving were attentive and super friendly. Kind of a small place and tucked away near Harris Teeter but absolutely a top contender for sushi in the area!

I don't know why I don't frequent this place more often, it's literally right across the street from me. Quick, friendly (sometimes a little scarily friendly) service, and inexpensive! Had an Ichiban Spicy Roll last time and it was tasty and spiced with sriracha. Also tried some sort of fried roll with a mayo based sauce, it was just aiite, and the Wasabi Salmon Roll that also had some sort of sauce that included sriracha, also, aiite. 

Overall, pretty good for a sushi place in Charlotte, and just right in the budget range.  

There can be a bit of a wait, even when you call ahead and are told there's no wait.

Wow! New Zealand Cafe at Sardis is a joke! We just walked out. We'd never been before. We got there around 6:45 tonight.The place is tiny and 3 people were ahead of us waiting. They said the wait was 25 mins. At 35 mins we started seeing people that came after us get seated. At 40 mins the host sat his buddies who had just walked up that were not on the list. When I confronted him & said we were leaving he said "Can I have your name so I can take it off the list" No apology. No I'll get you a table. I walked off. WORST customer service ever! People like that don't need to have service jobs. This place could have had new customers tonight, but not with unprofessional people like interacting with the customers.

I've heard rumors of a nondescript place around Costwold that served one of the better value sushi around.... they weren't joking. 

New Zealand Cafe is nestled in a strip mall, the dining room is small and the decor is not super inspirational... but when it comes to their sushi they don't mess around. Since it's so small, they only have one sushi chef and it takes them a while to be served, but man is it worth it. The flavors are succinct and as imaginative as some of the other 'fancy' sushi places around, but the value here can't be beat. They are an old friend that you can always come back to for a nice conversation and a good time. 

It's a very casual environment and the service is clean. During lunch try to come early because this place fills up to the gills... I'm sure to visit here again and again...
What a great find!! This place has amazing sushi at a great price. It is a bit small but the sushi is worth the wait.

Raised in the South Pacific, I saw New Zealand cafe and in my mind I was immediately transported to the islands and I was consuming good ol' island grub. This however was not the case when I walked into New Zealand Cafe. BUT, I was not disappointed, for being from the islands I also enjoy SEAFOOD! And sushi is New Zealand cafe's forte. Great sushi nonetheless. Their service is a little bit slow, but who can complain when their absolutely divine sushi hits your tastebuds. Yum! It's small so you really have to hit it at lunch or early dinner or else you'll be waiting forever. Try the pot stickers and then make your way to the plethora of sushi choices!! See you there.

AMAZING sushi rolls. My favorites here are their tempura rolls or unique creations of the sushi chefs (they have 3 sushi menus...)

My favorites?
Thousand Island, Ichiban Spicy, Spicy Scallop and Supercrunch. These are prepared to perfection and served by their very friendly waitstaff. They know thier NZ sushi--ask them anything!

ALWAYS packed at night, but worth the wait. Small dining room with even smaller sushi bar... but you still get outstanding service.
This restaurant is a delicious steal! Their prices are so low, no wonder it's always packed! Great for a quick bite or take-out. Don't be deterred by the strip mall, the food is great.

*Poor Customer Service. 
They got the order wrong and refused to admit that our order was missing an entire roll when we called back insinuating that we were lying. Sushi was above average but the terrible service left a bad taste in my mouth.
Cilantro roll is not on the menu but GREAT! Also their "Thai Hot Sour Soup" is to die for. Was not impressed with the Mango Chicken platter-- the sauce makes the chicken mushy.

My wife and I went here for the first time yesterday after hearing all the hype around this place.  

Not sure if it was an "off" day but it was hands down some of the worst service we've ever had, despite ordering nothing cooked (all sushi).  Our entire meal took 2 hours.  There was a 45 minute gap in between our appetizer (soup/salad) and our main entree (sushi).  The restaurant seemed more interested in fulfilling the take-out orders rather than attending to the dine-in customers.  The sushi itself was okay - not totally blown away by it.  Very disappointed.

Such great sushi, but if you call an order in, double the wait time that they give you. Last time I was here, I overheard a frustrated customer say it was the 3rd time she'd had to wait and wait on a to go order. Now here I stand, about 50 minutes into what was supposed to be a 25 minute wait, crowded against the drink station and hoping my order arrives soon. Miserable! But at least the reward at the end will be good...

Dropped in this evening for the first time after having a craving for sushi .  After viewing the menu online via phone, I made up my mind.  There were a couple people waiting/hanging outside.  There was a line but it moved quickly.  They take debit and split tenders with cash.  I was told the wait would be 30 mins after I paid.  I used the restroom and sat in a chair in the hallway.  Quickly 30 mins went by and a waitress stopped to ask if I was dining in and I told her I had an order.  I gave her the order number and she never responded back about it.  Yet, she came down the hallway often (backway to kitchen?), checked low drinks at tables, and seated two sets of people from the hallway.  I was sitting in the first chair in the hallway yet felt I wasn't as important since I had takeout.  Then 45mins went by and I got up to ask a waitress passing through the checkout line.  She grabbed my bag which seemed to have been ready for a couple mins or while.  Needless to say the meal was delicious even the Spicy Tuna which was a second choice for a little something extra to complete my meal of the Sweet Dragon.  I brewed some Oolong tea at home.  I will return for the Bento Box but I will call my orders in for now on.  Please call out takeout order numbers or have a waitress notify people when they're order is ready.  I will check for weekly specials and deals.  I hope they'll open a bigger location or second location.  Too small of the business is normally like this.

Get the Garden Salad (bigger salad) with ginger dressing. And any cool roll you'd like. It gets crowded. Perfect spot for that local feel. Its tight though, so watch out for toes and elbows. The younger team of girls seem to help each other. Take out at prime time is a must, really. Reservations; I would. Strip mall look. Miami sushi taste.

I love the sushi here.  It's a bit more expensive than your Harris Teeter fare,  but the taste is a world of a difference away!  I think you really get what you pay for.  The food is okay,  but the sushi is really what sells.  The place is a bit small and very tight especially during peak hours.
Not really a fan of this place it's very small the food isn't good always taste bland and old it's also noisy and dark I've only been here twice but I wouldn't spend my money here ever again

Do you like eating sushi? Do you like eavesdropping on your neighbor's conversations? If you're looking to do both, New Zealand Cafe will be right up your alley.

Come prepared to wait. The place is small and it's become very popular over the past several years. The sushi chefs behind the counter are rolling like crazy, but there's only so much room. If you're dining as a twosome, you'll be seated in the center section and you'll be within elbow's reach of the diners next to you. If you're lucky, you'll overhear an awkward first date. 

The wait and the cramped quarters are generally worth it -- the sushi is great and it's very inexpensive compared to other places in Charlotte. 

The only thing that keeps me from giving five stars to New Zealand is the accuracy. More than once, I've ordered scallop nigiri ("hotate gai") but I've received surf clam nigiri ("hokki gai"). Not a complete dealbreaker, but it's an unfortunate repeat issue. 

Overall, this place is great and affordable. Worth a visit for sure, especially before or after going to the movies across the street.

This place has ruined me for all other sushi!! Everywhere else I go, I'm so disappointed that it's not as good as New Zealand Cafe. ;D Yes, the place is tiny and usually packed. (That's part of its charm.) Yes, there is generally a decent wait time for carry out. We call ahead and just add 10 minutes on to whatever estimate they give us, and the timing works out fine. And it is always worth the wait!! We order sushi for our at-home date nights, every time we have something to celebrate, and whenever we have had a rough time of things and need comfort food. Besides my husband, this is the only number I have on speed dial! There are a TON of other sushi options in Charlotte, but none will measure up!

It might look like a hole in the wall but don't let it fool you-always fresh sushi when I lived in the area I dined here 5 days a week- the seaweed crab salad is always a favorite of mine love the golden crab roll and favorite roll- the plum wine is delicious as well as the fried banana!

Best sushi in Charlotte.  It also routinely takes all awards for it as well.  Not a fancy place.  Make sure to place your carry out order early as the line here can be crazy.  Wait for a table can be ridiculous but definitely worth it.

While the place was super busy and this is a great sign that the food is going to be great, I decided to get something to go. First time here waited at door until I was able to get my to go question answered. Went to register in back where I was promptly ignored by a early thirty thin Asian woman. She continued to ignore me while I waited for her to count money. Then she showed me she could indeed multi task by taking a phone order before she even said hello. 

Might still give it another go, just in case she  was having a bad night.
not happy at all... got my food home .no shrimp sauce and my rice was dry and everything else mushy...i wasted 16.00

Fresh and fun and tiny and cozy.  Friendly service. Sports tv playing on the screens in the corners. 

Good food, good prices. 

I've had the mango chicken and the bento box with sushi. Very tasty chicken (along with sesame noodles, salad, shrimp, and crab rangoon).  Bento box was a winner as well...the sushi was fabulous and fresh.  First time had the NZ white wine, second time the Kikkoman plum wine. The NZ was especially nice with the mango chicken. 

Eclectic mixture of people both times. I love the mood at this place. Hard to define. Welcoming but not intrusive.

This side of town does not afford many options in terms of Sushi.  Fortunately, we have NZ Cafe tucked away across the street from us.   This tiny place is always packed serving quality sushi at a great price.   We usually get carry out as most nights there is a wait for a table. 

I recommend the spider and sweet dragon rolls.  Definitely two of our favorites.

Our only "complaint" would be the size of the place.  It would nice if they could expand a bit to give everyone a little more elbow room.

I loved the sushi so much that I'd like to give 5 stars....but that would be overlooking other factors.  All the chairs there are high...the kind that make your feet dangle over the side as they can't reach the ground.  This is painful for people with certain medical conditions.  My wife was in pain the entire time we were there.

Also, the place was very tightly packed.  The tables were too small to allow you to stretch out at all.

The food was pretty good but I probably won't go back.
Amazing!!  Found this hidden treasure after searching for new places to try and I'm so glad we did!!  Fresh and delicious every time!  I drive 40 minutes so I can dine here!  Best sushi in town!!

Great sushi.  Great prices.  Tiny building.  We ONLY get takeout from New Zealand Cafe, because the inside is crazy small.  Everything we have had has been great.  Salmon and tuna rolls, steamed dumplings, miso soup, and entrees from the grill have all been fresh and delicious.  I highly recommend... just get it to go unless it's like 3:00 on a Tuesday.
This is my favorite sushi spot in Charlotte. Great customer service super friendly staff!! Give it a try!

This restaurant is WONDERFUL!  I have been here multiple times and have never been dissatisfied with my service.  My only complaint would be that they are always busy and the seating is very close to other patrons.  Despite this fact, I still love it here!

The food is amazing and hot, the waitresses are amazingly friendly, and they are quick!  I have tried several dishes on their menu and none have been dissatisfying.  My favorite on the menu would be the thai chicken curry.  

The prices aren't bad either.  ;-)

Some of the best sushi I've had in the Charlotte area! Tiny place and tucked away in a strip mall but you'll be a happy camper that you found it. Very fresh, I know this because it took a bit longer than  most sushi places to get my order (wasabi  tuna roll and yellowtail maki) but well worth the wait. The fish was cold and firm, a must for me to qualify the sushi as "fresh"! Some places have "wimpy" green wasabi, not this place, it's the very dense kind with a kick. I love the "sinus clearing" effect, great pickled ginger too! Very reasonable prices and they have lots of specials and a huge selection of rolls, some are even on a picture menu for the "novice" sushi eater. I did not try any of their hot entrees but saw several and they looked like good portions and tasty. The service was excellent, I was kind of in a hurry to get to a movie, they got me my check and cashed out right away when I let them know. I will be back here again soon! Definitely worth checking out :-)

I hate to write bad reviews, but I am literally blown away with how bad the sushi was from here. My husband has been wanting to try this place for a while, so we took the opportunity to order a bunch of rolls from here since we have family in town. 

First of all, when my husband called to place the order, they told him it would be ready in 15min....which seemed pretty fast for a Saturday night, but whatever. My husband shows up 20min later, only to end up sitting there waiting for the food to be ready for ANOTHER 55min (which means it was an hour and fifteen minutes from when he called, as opposed to the fifteen minutes he was originally told). Sadly, the odd wait and takeout situation wasn't even the worst part.

I've had really great sushi before (at a few different places in Charlotte), and I've also had really bad sushi. Now, I get that sushi taste can be sometimes subjective; but there are some things that everyone can agree are just bad. This food was one of those times. How do you screw up a shrimp tempura roll?? It wasn't even that it was takeout of a fried item, it was clearly WAY over cooked, and had brown avocado. Just nasty. And the rolls we had that contained tuna (or I should say were supposed to contain spicy tuna) actually looked like there was dried cheap canned tuna in them. When you spit a bite of something out, and throw the remaining entire roll into the trash, it's BAD. I've never been so embarrassed about our food choices before, but I was mortified that every persons sushi rolls were basically inedible. We ordered 8 rolls + a bento box...how you can have that bad statistical probability that all of it was that bad? 

Which brings me to my question: how on EARTH were they as busy as they were, and how do they have 4stars on yelp, if their food is this bad?

I'm lost. But you literally couldn't pay me good money to eat here ever again. Sad.

Side note: because I'm desperately trying to find something positive about this place, their side sauces were good. Also, the way that they packaged up our order was very nice.
Good sushi and Bento boxes. My wife is gluten free and always gets the Hibachi Chicken with gluten free soy sauce and substitutes the shrimp tempura with additional California roll.

Have been going here since 2007, sushi is consistently great! Excellent pricing! Love Cathy and Catherine, excellent service even better sushi. Love this place, the food and the staff. (Mexican roll, Favorite roll, Valentine roll...personal favorites)

I had heard a lot of praise about this place and had been wanting to try it for a while. Unfortunately I will not be returning, as it took us(2 people) nearly 2 hours to complete dinner. We ordered crab salad to start and 4 rolls to split. It took over 30 min for the crab salad to come out and nearly 1.5 hours for the rolls. Being that the place is so small we could easily see the issue, they were filling every single takeout order prior to the dine in orders. We could clearly see the sushi chefs working on nothing but takeout orders. Orders should be filled based on when they hit the system and it blows my mind that they would neglect the customers that chose to dine in. After leaving I scanned the reviews and noticed that this seems to be a common issue here. It's truly unfortunate that they have such a poor system in place because the sushi was actually good and if not for this major issue I would absolutely return.

Best sushi in Charlotte!!! We just moved back from Europe and know fresh sushi. The staff is great too. Must get there early or you'll have to wait - but it's worth the wait!  Light on the rice and heavy on fresh fish :). Only thing I would like to see a change in is a better quality wine selection.

I am not sure where all of the 5 and 4 star reviews are coming from in regards to New Zealand Cafe.  We were told to try this restaurant by numerous people when we moved to the area, they told us it was the best sushi in Charlotte and that we would love it because we love sushi so much.  We tried it two different times, on two different days to be sure of our opinion.  It is not good.  Definitely not the best in Charlotte, or in the area for that matter.  The sushi is huge, HUGE. It is a serious challenge to eat without falling completely apart.  Most of the sushi is rice, not a lot of fish going on.  The salmon was good but the tuna tasted off so we didn't even finish those rolls that had tuna in them.  The restaurant is tiny. We were sat no more than a foot from the people on either side of us, so their conversations were basically our conversations the entire time. We did sit outside the first time but with people waiting it was kind of awkward to have people hovering over us while trying to enjoy the over-riced-over-sized bland sushi.  Other reviewers have mentioned it tastes like grocery sushi, that I agree with.  Maybe the prices draw people in and that's why they think it's great.  Most of the rolls are fried in some way, which is probably necessary because some of the fish simply was not fresh and we could not continue eating it.  The service was not great either time we went, if they change things, perhaps we will try it again, until then, on to the much much better sushi Charlotte has to offer!

When I first visited Charlotte back in September, this was the first restaurant I visited (seeing its very close to Inner Peaks).

The rolls are cheap/moderately priced, the staff are friendly and the atmosphere is very homey.

The one thing that really stands out is the sushi chef's attention to detail and focus on ACTUALLY giving a dang about presentation. They're also relatively innovative with the rolls offered; my one friend had the Island Roll which was wrapped in cucumber strips rather than seaweed and rice. Pretty rad.

Yeah, I'm pretty sure I'll drop in here quite a bit whenever I'm in the area.

I've been here quite a few times and I can honestly say that this is a true hidden gem in Charlotte! Some of the freshest sushi and delicious rolls. The inside is very cramped and they are almost always on a wait but the prices are affordable and the the quality is good. Try the $1 Sushi pieces if you like Nigiri.
Absolutely one of my favorite sushi spots in Charlotte. It's easy, not stuffy, and consistent. My entire family loves New Zealand.

This place is great! I used to think it was my own little secret, but it is always packed...guess the secret is out! I don't like shshi, but if you do, this place is for you. They have all of the classics, and on Tuesdays its all $1. I love the teriyaki chicken,  garlic noodles, brown rice, and love the fries shrimp! I've never dined in, but get to-go often. The food is always fresh amd always meets my expectations. If you find yourself near the corner of Monroe Rd and Sardis Rd N, you should stop in! It is hidden in the Harris Teeter shopping center.
I love all the sushi I've tried here. It's a smaller restaurant but it's very good! Reasonable priced rolls!

My husband and I love coming here for date night!! The food is cheap, fresh and delicious! If your looking to avoid the swanky restaurant scene, I would highly recommend coming here. New Zealand Cafe offers a laid back atmosphere. The staff is very attentive to customers with allergies. Sadly my husband is allergic to shellfish, so he switches ingredients like shrimp for Imitation crab. I'm happy to report he's never had an outbreak here, and he loves the food. 

I wouldn't recommend coming here for dinner, unless it's durning the weekday. Considering the restaurant is small, it's difficult to get a table. We typically arrive 10mins after they open, or order food to go.

I hope New Zealand Cafe opens another location one day!

I have very mixed feelings about this place. I love sushi and think the sushi here is pretty good and the rolls are creative. However, the place is realllly small and cramped and the service dining in is mediocre. Take out service is awful, they tell you 25 minutes on the phone and you end up waiting up to (or even longer than) an hour. Last time I was here I waited for my take out order over an hour and when I asked for a second time if it would be much longer (politely, but I'm sure you could detect slight irritation in my voice) I was told very rudely that it would come out soon and to sit down and wait......like excuse me? At least apologize that I've been here for over an hour...or just don't snap at me! Personally, I would rather go somewhere with decent food and better atmosphere.

Who knew? This little gem is tucked away in the Harris Teeter shopping center in Matthews. It's small but apparently regulars know about it - there was a wait at 6pm on a Thursday! Chilly outside temps meant our table by the door was rather unfortunate with so many people coming & going & holding the door open for extended lengths of time. Brrrr!

Now, I should point out that this place is known for their sushi. I don't each fish - raw or otherwise, so I can't speak to what they're known for; other than to say my friends all raved about the Tiger Roll & Christmas Roll. I did, however, order the Daily Vegetable Special and the Vegetable Tempura rolls. This was my first time trying anything remotely sushi-related and my first time eating with chopsticks (they don't readily provide forks!! Well, they might if you NEED one and ask for it.) Our food was served in a very elaborate wooded boat, which was fun. The servers were very quick with our drink orders & refills.

I thought the food was flavorful & fresh. I'd skip the fried bananas & bananas sushi for dessert, but others seemed to enjoy the green tea ice cream for something unusual.

Next time, I'll probably try one of their pork or chicken meals for what seemed like a larger portion at a reasonable price.
We got a pretty good selection of different rolls - it was just OK it wasn't special and it definitely wasn't fabulous so I can honestly say we won't be back

I'm going to give this place a 4.5 and an extra .5 star for the wait staff enthusiasm.  Have to agree with most of the reviews of this place since it is very unassuming and located in a strip mall.  The place has a lot of charm and personality and I am really glad it is in my neck of the woods.  I can totally see myself becoming a regular here.

I had the Tuna Crunchy Roll and the Sweet Dragon Roll which were both outstanding for the price.  We did have a little bit of a wait because there was a huge sushi order prior to ours... It was pretty amazing to see 4-5 sushi boats filled to the brim be delivered over to a 4 person table.  They ended up not finishing everything and having 3 full size take home boxes of sushi!  Maybe they were bringing them over to an adult baseball league afterwards...  It was a ton of sushi. 

Can't wait to go back and sample more rolls and maybe a bento box or 30.  The menu took a while to read through, but I'm sure all the options are just as good as what I ordered.

The wait-staff was very warm and inviting... one of the waitresses in particular recognized some regulars and it was hard not to be swept up in her enthusiasm.  Definitely hard to find positive people like that now a days especially in a tough position serving others.

My all-time favorite sushi place! I think they've been voted one of the best sushi places in Charlotte for a long time now. I'm never dissatisfied and it's always delicious. The only negative thing is the dining room is tiny but we always get takeout anyways. If it's on the weekend be ready to wait! They're good.

This is our go-to place. The sushi is always amazing. They also have really great chinese-style stir fries that are great for people who aren't fans of sushi. The staff is great, and it's a cozy place. Always busy so give yourself extra time in case there's a wait.

Best Sushi in Charlotte! Good for SMALL groups. Very very small restaurant, always crowded. But the food is so worth the hassle. I don't go anywhere else anymore. Be prepared to have a wait and to be sitting close to other people and have your taste buds blown away!

The atmosphere is remenicent of back alley food truck. At lunch the service is super slow, if you get your food at all. The sushi tastes somewhere between grocery store and buffet with the grocery store being the better of the two. Will not be eating here again and I hope I do not have food poisoning.
Just to update...my girlfriend and I both have food poisoning.

Guess they are so busy they dont need new customers. Took my daughter to lunch had our name on the list sat and waited for a table and they seat 2 tables who just walked in before us after waiting 25 mins. Really? Thanks we were looking for a good place but weather the foods worth it or not customer service is needed i my opinion.

Friendly service.  Americanized Indonesian entrees.  Average sushi with above average presentation.  Dressings and sauces 2 stars.  Not a bad place but not some place I would go out of my way to visit.

Teeny tiny, and in a strip shopping center...don't let that stop you from experiencing fabulous food. My neighbors from South Africa discovered it...my first clue that it was going to be great. They have excellent and out-of-the-ordinary taste in food. Good service in small space. Really odd atmosphere, but tons of delicious food. It will take you 10 minutes to read the menu and decide. It's extensive!! Sushi, teriyaki, stir fry, vegetarian, seafood, beef, chicken, platter...holy cow!!! We do a LOT of takeout. Best fried rice in town. You sit RIGHT next to your neighbor, kind of like a exotic neighborhood diner.

Visiting from out of state.  A couple of friends wanted to eat here. I thought ok. The waiter wasn't friendly at all. Didn't seem to know much about the menu.  Seemed to be annoyed because I wanted to do a substitute.  Food came out.  The teriyaki chicken was coated very well in the sauce.  I wouldn't comeback.
This place has gone down. From the mediocre place it had before. The food isn't good at all save your money and the time it takes to get in there.

I am always in search of a great sushi place with fresh fish and decent prices and I was really hoping NZ Cafe would fit the bill. We walked in and the place was absolutely slammed for a Monday, so that was a great sign.

The seating is a bit too close for comfort in my opinion- conversations next to us were distracting as I am sure we were to others as well. Service was poor and slow . We had two servers (I think?), my point is that I really had no idea who our actual server was.

we ordered four rolls:

christmas, sweet dragon, crazy, and discovery


We only really cared for two out of four (s.d and christmas) - disovery was one of the worst rolls I have ever had - very fishy tasting and honestly sloppy.I had an issue with the overall temperature of all the rolls - very warm and the avocado on the rolls was a mushy mess.

 We must have read the menu wrong because we thought we were getting three unfried rolls and one fried but two ended up being over-fried almost to the point where they lost any of the delicateness of sushi. Lastly I am a big fan of wasabi and tend to add quite a bit to my low sodium soy, but they must have super-salty wasabi paste because it was almost inedible....and not spicy enough. 

On a positive note the wooden boat displays were a really cool idea and certainly warranted us taking a few photos. 

Overall though, the distance and quality make this a no-go for me ...

This may be the best sushi I've had in Charlotte. I stopped by with a friend for lunch and surprised to find the place not too overly packed. We ordered a few sushi rolls were presented well and tasted great. I saw some of the other customers order bento boxes for lunch. Will definitely be back again!

I have a confession... I'm slightly obsessed with sushi . 

My husband and I were in the area for dinner.  We walk into New Zealand and there is a line waiting to be seated.  This is on a Monday night.  That is a strong testament to how good this place is.

I was told there was a 20 minute wait.  I asked the hostess if I could place my sushi order so it would be ready when the table was ready and she said sure!!  She even brought drinks to us while we were waiting.

Our table was actually ready way quicker than she thought!

Our sushi took a while to come out because they were so busy!

Everything was delicious.  We devoured it quickly!  We ordered the valentine roll, the Christmas roll, and the favorite roll. 

My favorite was the valentine roll.  I highly recommend New Zealand if you aren't in a rush for lunch/dinner.  The prices are also very reasonable.

There is no better sushi in this area of Charlotte.  Period.

When we lived in Elizabeth on the east side of uptown Charlotte, we would sometimes drive all the way to New Zealand Cafe simply because the sushi is that good, and the prices are low!  If you live in this area or just happen to be in the area and surfing Yelp for where to grab a bite, you have to try New Zealand Cafe!.

Very good sushi and extremely great pricing.

This is the sushi spot I have been looking for since moving to Charlotte a year and a half ago!!! I am so glad someone gave my boyfriend a tip to try this place out. We went on a Sunday night and it was packed!! It's tiny and we had to wait for a table. I will say as much as we enjoyed the sushi, the dining experience was a little uncomfortable because the tables were so close we were basically sitting with two other couples and the servers could barely get around. 

The rolls are so cheap! I think the most expensive one was $11. We got four and enjoyed them all besides the hot tuna, just not our style. Favorite was the big boss roll! Everything tasted fresh and of good quality. 

Will definitely be back the next time we want sushi. You get twice as much for the money here than other places I have been in Charlotte and it tastes just as good, if not better!

After all these years working in the area and living not far away, and even being told to make it to New Zealand, I never had done so.  One day, we decided to pop in, and who should be there but Julia S.?  Sometimes things just work out that way.

First, do not expect a lot from the atmosphere.  You are in a strip mall, after all, and you have to dig somewhat to find the place - but once inside, you get maybe a dozen tables, and it can get cramped since they get a bit busy.

Service is good, however, and the food is good too.  I really cannot comment on the sushi itself, as I am not much of an expert, but I find that it is better than some (Ru San's), and perhaps not as good as others (Osaka).  There are some cool options (the boat was a neat touch).  You also get a lot of food for the price.  Definitely worth checking out if you are in the area.

Awesome food but I always have order to go because it is so congested and small! No comfortable waiting space either so I sit in my car until my food is ready... so unfortunate... if they get a bigger space,  I would definitely give them give stars because the food is THAT good!

This was my second visit here , dont let the outside fool you its a hole in the wall lol The food is amazing you can get Sushi or Bento box an its much food an such a great price.  My friend ordered the sushi she loved it an I had bento box with sweet n sour chicken, crab ragon, salad, egg roll I ate it all lol  The staff is very friendly they also have a small bar. If your in the area make a stop you wont regret it.

We came to check out New Zealand Cafe based on the great reviews. I had my doubts once we pulled down a long road of dead strip malls. The restaurant was busy so I figured, "hey, maybe it's ok?" Turns out our rolls were nothing special and not worth the drive. They were big and hard to eat. The search for a place better than RuSan continues!
I am a rookie to sushi, but this place is very good and has an great menu selection.  Don't let it's location in a strip mall fool you, it's a very popular place so expect having to wait for a table.

This is the best sushi place in Charlotte. The problem is there is hardly any seating and the wait is very long! However, it is worth it. They have a large variety of options! I wouldn't waste my time on anything other than sushi if I were you. Also, the prices are very reasonable. Be prepared, it can get quite crowded! It has a very "whole in the wall" vice though.

Worst sushi place I've ever been to. The service took so long , my toddler started getting uncomfortable because he was hungry and the food just took way too long to arrive. Ones the food arrived it was terrible , my sushi just fell apart every time I tried picking it up and they didn't set the table appropriately , we had to continuously ask them for napkins , straws and chopsticks.
